12.John Medows Rodwell: Verily, I am thy Lord:. therefore pull off thy shoes: for thou art in the holy valley of Towa

13.John Medows Rodwell: And I have chosen thee: hearken then to what shall be revealed

14.John Medows Rodwell: Verily, I am God: there is no God but me: therefore worship me, and observe prayer for a remembrance of me

15.John Medows Rodwell: Verily the hour is coming: - I all but manifest it - That every soul may be recompensed for its labours

16.John Medows Rodwell: Nor let him who believeth not therein and followeth his lust, turn thee aside from this truth, and thou perish

17.John Medows Rodwell: Now, what is that in thy right hand, O Moses?"

18.John Medows Rodwell: Said he, "It is my staff on which I lean, and with which I beast down leaves for my sheep, and I have other uses for it."

19.John Medows Rodwell: He said, "Cast it down, O Moses!"

20.John Medows Rodwell: So he cast it down, and lo! it became a serpent that ran along

21.John Medows Rodwell: He said, "Lay hold on it, and fear not: to its former state will we restore it."

22.John Medows Rodwell: "Now place thy right hand to thy arm-pit: it shall come forth white, but unhurt: - another sign!

23.John Medows Rodwell: That We may shew thee the greatest of our signs

24.John Medows Rodwell: Go to Pharaoh, for he hath burst all bounds."

25.John Medows Rodwell: He said, "O my Lord! enlarge my breast for me

26.John Medows Rodwell: And make my work easy for me

27.John Medows Rodwell: And loose the knot of my tongue

28.John Medows Rodwell: That they may understand my speech

29.John Medows Rodwell: And give me a counsellor from among my family

30.John Medows Rodwell: Aaron my brother

31.John Medows Rodwell: By him gird up my loins

32.John Medows Rodwell: And make him a colleague in my work

33.John Medows Rodwell: That we may praise thee of

34.John Medows Rodwell: and oft remember thee

35.John Medows Rodwell: For thou regardest us."

36.John Medows Rodwell: He said, "O Moses, thou hast obtained thy suit

37.John Medows Rodwell: Already, at another time, have we showed thee favour

38.John Medows Rodwell: When we spake unto thy mother what was spoken

39.John Medows Rodwell: 'Cast him into the ark: then cast him on the sea [the river], and the sea shall throw him on the shore: and an enemy to me and an enemy to him shall take him up.' And I myself have made thee an object of love, That thou mightest be reared in mine eye

40.John Medows Rodwell: When thy sister went and said, 'Shall I shew you one who will nurse him?' Then We returned thee to thy mother that her eye might be cheered, and that she might not grieve. And when thou slewest a person, We delivered thee from trouble, and We tried thee with other trial. For years didst thou stay among the people of Midian; then camest thou hither by my decree, O Moses

41.John Medows Rodwell: And I have chosen thee for Myself

42.John Medows Rodwell: Go thou and thy brother with my signs and be not slack to remember me

43.John Medows Rodwell: Go ye to Pharaoh, for he hath burst all bounds

44.John Medows Rodwell: But speak ye to him with gentle speech; haply he will reflect or fear."

45.John Medows Rodwell: They said, "O our Lord! truly we fear lest he break forth against us, or act with exceeding injustice."

46.John Medows Rodwell: He said, "Fear ye not, for I am with you both. I will hearken and I will behold

47.John Medows Rodwell: Go ye then to him and say, 'Verily we are Sent ones of thy Lord; send therefore the children of Israel with us and vex them not: now are we come to thee with signs from thy Lord, and, Peace shall be on him who followeth the right guidance

48.John Medows Rodwell: For now hath it been revealed to us, that chastisement shall be on him who chargeth with falsehood, and turneth him away."

49.John Medows Rodwell: And he said, "Who is your Lord, O Moses?"

50.John Medows Rodwell: He said, "Our Lord is He who hath given to everything its form and then guideth it aright."

51.John Medows Rodwell: "But what," said he, "was the state of generations past?"

52.John Medows Rodwell: He said, "The knowledge thereof is with my Lord in the Book of his decrees. My Lord erreth not, nor forgetteth

53.John Medows Rodwell: He hath spread the earth as a bed, and hath traced out paths for you therein, and hath sent down rain from Heaven, and by it we bring forth the kinds of various herbs

54.John Medows Rodwell: - 'Eat ye, and feed your cattle.' Of a truth in this are signs unto men endued with understanding

55.John Medows Rodwell: From it have we created you, and into it will we return you, and out of it will we bring you forth a second time."

56.John Medows Rodwell: And we shewed him all our signs: but he treated them as falsehoods, and refused to believe

57.John Medows Rodwell: He said, "Hast thou come, O Moses, to drive us from our land by thine enchantments

58.John Medows Rodwell: Therefore will we assuredly confront thee with like enchantments: so appoint a meeting between us and you - we will not fail it, we, and do not thou - in a place alike for both."

59.John Medows Rodwell: He said, "On the feast day be your meeting, and in broad daylight let the people be assembled."

60.John Medows Rodwell: And Pharaoh turned away, and collected his craftsmen and came

61.John Medows Rodwell: Said Moses to them, "Woe to you! devise not a lie against God: For then will he destroy you by a punishment. They who have lied have ever perished."

62.John Medows Rodwell: And the magicians discussed their plan, and spake apart in secret

63.John Medows Rodwell: They said, "These two are surely sorcerers: fain would they drive you from your land by their sorceries, and lead away in their paths your chiefest men

64.John Medows Rodwell: So muster your craft: then come in order: well this day shall it be for him, who shall gain the upper hand."

65.John Medows Rodwell: They said, "O Moses, wilt thou first cast down thy rod, or shall we be the first who cast?"

66.John Medows Rodwell: He said, "Yes, cast ye down first." And lo! by their enchantment their cords and rods seemed to him as if they ran

67.John Medows Rodwell: And Moses conceived a secret fear within him

68.John Medows Rodwell: We said, "Fear not, for thou shalt be the uppermost

69.John Medows Rodwell: Cast forth then what is in thy right hand: it shall swallow up what they have produced: they have only produced the deceit of an enchanter: and come where he may, ill shall an enchanter fare."

70.John Medows Rodwell: And the magicians fell down and worshipped. They said, "We believe in the Lord of Aaron and of Moses."

71.John Medows Rodwell: Said Pharaoh, "Believe ye on him ere I give you leave? He, in sooth, is your Master who hath taught you magic. I will therefore cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will crucify you on trunks of the palm, and assuredly shall ye learn which of us is severest in punishing, and who is the more abiding."

72.John Medows Rodwell: They said, "We will not have more regard to thee than to the clear tokens which have come to us, or than to Him who hath made us: doom the doom thou wilt: Thou canst only doom as to this present life

73.John Medows Rodwell: of a truth we have believed on our Lord that he may pardon us our sins and the sorcery to which thou hast forced us, for God is better, and more abiding than thou

74.John Medows Rodwell: As for him who shall come before his Lord laden with crime - for him verily is Hell: he shall not die in it and he shall not live

75.John Medows Rodwell: But he who shall come before Him, a believer, with righteous works, - these! the loftiest grades await them

76.John Medows Rodwell: Gardens of Eden, beneath whose trees the rivers flow: therein shall they abide for ever. This, the reward of him who hath been pure."

77.John Medows Rodwell: Then revealed we to Moses, "Go forth by night with my servants and cleave for them a dry path in the sea; Fear not thou to be overtaken, neither be thou afraid."

78.John Medows Rodwell: And Pharaoh followed them with his hosts, and the whelming billows of the sea overwhelmed them

79.John Medows Rodwell: for Pharaoh misled his people, and did not guide them

80.John Medows Rodwell: O children of Israel! we rescued you from your foes; and We appointed a meeting with you on the right side of the mountain; and We caused the manna and the quail to descend upon you

81.John Medows Rodwell: "Eat," said We, "of the good things with which we have supplied you; but without excess, lest my wrath fall upon you; for on whom my wrath doth fall, he perisheth outright

82.John Medows Rodwell: Surely however will I forgive him who turneth to God and believeth, and worketh righteousness, and then yieldeth to guidance

83.John Medows Rodwell: But what hath hastened thee on apart from thy people, O Moses?"

84.John Medows Rodwell: He said, "They are hard on my footsteps: but to thee, O Lord, have I hastened, that thou mightest be well pleased with me."

85.John Medows Rodwell: He said, "Of a truth now have we proved thy people since thou didst leave them, and Samiri had led them astray."

86.John Medows Rodwell: And Moses returned to his people, angered, sorrowful. He said, "O my people! did not your Lord promise you a good promise? Was the time of my absence long to you? or desired ye that wrath from your Lord should light upon you, that ye failed in your promise to me?"

87.John Medows Rodwell: They said, "Not of our own accord have we failed in the promise to thee, but we were made to bring loads of the people's trinkets, and we threw them into the fire and Samiri likewise cast them in

88.John Medows Rodwell: and brought forth to them a corporeal lowing calf: and they said, "This is your God and the God of Moses, whom he hath forgotten."

89.John Medows Rodwell: What! saw they not that it returned them no answer, and could neither hurt nor help them

90.John Medows Rodwell: And Aaron had before said to them, "O my people! by this calf are ye only proved: surely your Lord is the God of Mercy: follow me therefore and obey my bidding."

91.John Medows Rodwell: They said, "We will not cease devotion to it, till Moses come back to us."

92.John Medows Rodwell: He said, "O Aaron! when thou sawest that they had gone astray, what hindered the

93.John Medows Rodwell: from following me? Hast thou then disobeyed my command?"

94.John Medows Rodwell: He said, "O Son of my mother! seize me not by my beard, nor by my head: indeed I feared lest thou shouldst say, Thou hast rent the children of Isreal asunder, and hast not observed my orders."

95.John Medows Rodwell: He said, "And what was thy motive, O Samiri?"

96.John Medows Rodwell: He said, "I saw what they saw not: so I took a handful of dust from the track of the messenger of God, and flung it into the calf, for so my soul prompted me."

97.John Medows Rodwell: He said, "Begone then: verily thy doom even in this life shall be to say, 'Touch me not.' And there is a threat against thee, which thou shalt not escape hereafter. Now look at thy god to which thou hast continued so devoted: we will surely burn it and reduce it to ashes, which we will cast into the sea

98.John Medows Rodwell: Your God is God, beside whom there is no God: In his knowledge he embraceth all things."

99.John Medows Rodwell: Thus do We recite to thee histories of what passed of old; and from ourself have we given thee admonition

100.John Medows Rodwell: Whoso shall turn aside from it shall verily carry a burden on the day of Resurrection

101.John Medows Rodwell: Under it shall they remain: and grievous, in the day of Resurrection, shall it be to them to bear

102.John Medows Rodwell: On that day there shall be a blast on the trumpet, and We will gather the wicked together on that day with leaden eyes

103.John Medows Rodwell: They shall say in a low voice, one to another, - "Ye tarried but ten days on earth."

104.John Medows Rodwell: We are most knowing with respect to that which they will say when the most veracious of them will say. "Ye have not tarried above a day."

105.John Medows Rodwell: And they will ask thee of the mountains: SAY: scattering my Lord will scatter them in dust

106.John Medows Rodwell: And he will leave them a level plain

107.John Medows Rodwell: thou shalt see in it no hollows or jutting hills

108.John Medows Rodwell: On that day shall men follow their summoner - he marcheth straight on: and low shall be their voices before the God of Mercy, nor shalt thou hear aught but the light footfall

109.John Medows Rodwell: No intercession shall avail on that day, save his whom the God of Mercy shall allow to intercede, and whose words he shall approve

110.John Medows Rodwell: He knoweth their future and their past; but in their own knowledge they comprehend it not:

111.John Medows Rodwell: And humble shall be their faces before Him that Liveth, the Self-subsisting: and undone he, who shall bear the burden of iniquity

112.John Medows Rodwell: But he who shall have done the things that are right and is a believer, shall fear neither wrong nor loss

113.John Medows Rodwell: Thus have We sent down to thee an Arabic Koran, and have set forth menaces therein diversely, that haply they may fear God, or that it may give birth to reflection in them

114.John Medows Rodwell: Exalted then be God, the King, the Truth! Be not hasty in its recital while the revelation of it to thee is incomplete. Say rather, "O my Lord, increase knowledge unto me."

115.John Medows Rodwell: And of old We made a covenant with Adam; but he forgat it; and we found no firmness of purpose in him

116.John Medows Rodwell: And when We said to the angels, "Fall down and worship Adam," they worshipped all, save Eblis, who refused

117.John Medows Rodwell: and We said, "O Adam! this truly is a foe to thee and to thy wife. Let him not therefore drive you out of the garden, and ye become wretched

118.John Medows Rodwell: For to thee is it granted that thou shalt not hunger therein, neither shalt thou be naked

120.John Medows Rodwell: But Satan whispered him: said he, "O Adam! shall I shew thee the tree of Eternity, and the Kingdom that faileth not?"

121.John Medows Rodwell: And they both ate thereof, and their nakedness appeared to them, and they began to sew of the leaves of the Garden to cover them, and Adam disobeyed his Lord and went astray

122.John Medows Rodwell: Afterwards his Lord chose him for himself, and was turned towards him, and guided him

123.John Medows Rodwell: And God said, "Get ye all down hence, the one of you a foe unto the other. Hereafter shall guidance come unto you from me; And whoso followeth my guidance shall not err, and shall not be wretched

124.John Medows Rodwell: But whoso turneth away from my monition, his truly shall be a life of misery: And We will assemble him with others on the day of Resurrection, blind."

125.John Medows Rodwell: He will say, "O my Lord! why hast thou assembled me with others, blind? whereas I was endowed with sight."

126.John Medows Rodwell: He will answer, "Thus is it, because our signs came unto thee and thou didst forget them, and thus shalt thou be forgotten this day."

127.John Medows Rodwell: Even thus will We recompense him who hath transgressed and hath not believed in the signs of his Lord; and assuredly the chastisement of the next world will be more severe and more lasting

128.John Medows Rodwell: Are not they, who walk the very places where they dwelt, aware how many generations we have destroyed before them? Verily in this are signs to men of insight

129.John Medows Rodwell: And had not a decree of respite from thy Lord first gone forth, their chastisement had at once ensued. Yet the time is fixed

130.John Medows Rodwell: Put up then with what they say; and celebrate the praise of thy Lord before the sunrise, and before its setting; and some time in the night do thou praise him, and in the extremes of the day, that thou haply mayest please Him

131.John Medows Rodwell: And strain not thine eye after what We have bestowed on divers of them - the braveries of this world - that we may thereby prove them. The portion which thy Lord will give, is better and more lasting

132.John Medows Rodwell: Enjoin prayer on thy family, and persevere therein. We ask not of thee to find thine own provision - we will provide for thee, and a happy issue shall there be to piety

133.John Medows Rodwell: But they say, "If he come not to us with a sign from his Lord . . .!" But have not clear proofs for the Koran come to them, in what is in the Books of old

134.John Medows Rodwell: And had We destroyed them by a chastisement before its time, they would surely have said, "O our Lord! How could we believe if thou didst not send unto us an Apostle that we might follow thy signs ere that we were humbled and disgraced."

135.John Medows Rodwell: SAY: Each one of us awaiteth the end. Wait ye then, and ye shall know which of us have been followers of the even way, and who hath been the rightly guided

1.John Medows Rodwell: THIS people's reckoning hath drawn nigh, yet, sunk in carelessness, they turn aside

2.John Medows Rodwell: Every fresh warning that cometh to them from their Lord they only hear to mock it,

3.John Medows Rodwell: Their hearts set on lusts: and they who have done this wrong say in secret discourse, "Is He more than a man like yourselves? What! will ye, with your eyes open, accede to sorcery?"

4.John Medows Rodwell: SAY: "My Lord knoweth what is spoken in the heaven and on the earth: He is the Hearer, the Knower."

5.John Medows Rodwell: "Nay," say they, "it is the medley of dreams: nay, he hath forged it: nay, he is a poet: let him come to us with a sign as the prophets of old were sent."

6.John Medows Rodwell: Before their time, none of the cities which we have destroyed, believed: will these men, then, believe

7.John Medows Rodwell: And we sent none, previous to thee, but men to whom we had revealed ourselves. Ask ye the people who are warned by Scriptures, if ye know it not

8.John Medows Rodwell: We gave them not bodies which could dispense with food: and they were not to live for ever

9.John Medows Rodwell: Then made we good our promise to them; and we delivered them and whom we pleased, and we destroyed the transgressors

10.John Medows Rodwell: And now have we sent down to you "the book," in which is your warning: What, will ye not then understand

11.John Medows Rodwell: And how many a guilty city have we broken down, and raised up after it other peoples

12.John Medows Rodwell: And when they felt our vengeance, lo! they fled from it

13.John Medows Rodwell: "Flee not," said the angels in mockery, "but come back to that wherein ye revelled, and to your abodes! Questions will haply be put to you."

14.John Medows Rodwell: They said, "Oh, woe to us! Verily we have been evil doers."

15.John Medows Rodwell: And this ceased not to be their cry, until we made them like reaped corn, extinct

16.John Medows Rodwell: We created not the heaven and the earth, and what is between them, for sport

17.John Medows Rodwell: Had it been our wish to find a pastime, we had surely found it in ourselves; - if to do so had been our will

18.John Medows Rodwell: Nay, we will hurl the truth at falsehood, and it shall smite it, and lo! it shall vanish. But woe be to you for what ye utter of God

19.John Medows Rodwell: All beings in the heaven and on the earth are His: and they who are in his presence disdain not his service, neither are they wearied

20.John Medows Rodwell: They praise Him night and day: they rest not

21.John Medows Rodwell: Have they taken gods from the earth who can quicken the dead

22.John Medows Rodwell: Had there been in either heaven or earth gods besides God, both surely had gone to ruin. But glory be to God, the Lord of the throne, beyond what they utter

23.John Medows Rodwell: He shall not be asked of his doings, but they shall be asked

24.John Medows Rodwell: Have they taken other gods beside Him? SAY; Bring forth your proofs that they are gods. This is the warning of those who are with me, and the warning of those who were before me: but most of them know not the truth, and turn aside

25.John Medows Rodwell: No apostle have we sent before thee to whom we did not reveal that "Verily there is no God beside me: therefore worship me."

26.John Medows Rodwell: Yet they say, "The God of Mercy hath begotten issue from the angels." Glory be to Him! Nay, they are but His honoured servants

27.John Medows Rodwell: They speak not till He hath spoken; and they do His bidding

28.John Medows Rodwell: He knoweth what is before them and what is behind them; and no plea shall they offer Save for whom He pleaseth; and they tremble for fear of Him

29.John Medows Rodwell: And that angel among them who saith "I am a god beside Him," will we recompense with hell: in such sort will we recompense the offenders

30.John Medows Rodwell: Do not the infidels see that the heavens and the earth were both a solid mass, and that we clave them asunder, and that by means of water we give life to everything? Will they not then believe

31.John Medows Rodwell: And we set mountains on the earth lest it should move with them, and we made on it broad passages between them as routes for their guidance

32.John Medows Rodwell: And we made the heaven a roof strongly upholden; yet turn they away from its signs

33.John Medows Rodwell: And He it is who hath created the night and the day, and the sun and the moon, each moving swiftly in its sphere

34.John Medows Rodwell: At no time have we granted to man a life that shall last for ever: if thou then die, shall they live for ever

35.John Medows Rodwell: Every soul shall taste of death: and for trial will we prove you with evil and with good; and unto Us shall ye be brought back

36.John Medows Rodwell: And when the infidels see thee they receive thee only with scoffs: - "What! is this he who maketh such mention of your gods?" Yet when mention is made to them of the God of Mercy, they believe not

37.John Medows Rodwell: "Man," say they, "is made up of haste." But I will shew you my signs: desire them not then to be hastened

38.John Medows Rodwell: They say, "When will this threat be made good? Tell us, if ye be men of truth?"

39.John Medows Rodwell: Did the infidels but know the time when they shall not be able to keep the fire of hell from their faces or from their backs, neither shall they be helped

40.John Medows Rodwell: But it shall come on them suddenly and shall confound them; and they shall not be able to put it back, neither shall they be respited

41.John Medows Rodwell: Other apostles have been scoffed at before thee: but that doom at which they mocked encompassed the scoffers

42.John Medows Rodwell: SAY: Who shall protect you by night and by day from the God of Mercy? Yet turn they away from the warning of their Lord

43.John Medows Rodwell: Have they gods beside Us who can defend them? For their own succour have they no power; neither shall the gods they join with God screen them from Us

44.John Medows Rodwell: Yes! we have given these men and their fathers enjoyments so long as their life lasted. What! see they not that we come to a land and straiten its borders Is it they who are the conquerors

45.John Medows Rodwell: SAY: I only warn you of what hath been revealed to me: but the deaf will not hear the call, whenever they are warned

46.John Medows Rodwell: Yet if a breath of thy Lord's chastisement touch them, they will assuredly say, "Oh! woe to us! we have indeed been offenders."

47.John Medows Rodwell: Just balances will we set up for the day of the resurrection, neither shall any soul be wronged in aught; though, were a work but the weight of a grain of mustard seed, we would bring it forth to be weighed: and our reckoning will suffice

48.John Medows Rodwell: We gave of old to Moses and Aaron the illumination, and a light and a warning for the God-fearing

49.John Medows Rodwell: Who dread their Lord in secret, and who tremble for "the Hour."

50.John Medows Rodwell: And this Koran which we have sent down is a blessed warning: will ye then disown it

51.John Medows Rodwell: Of old we gave unto Abraham his direction, for we knew him worthy

52.John Medows Rodwell: When he said to his Father and to his people, "What are these images to which ye are devoted?"

53.John Medows Rodwell: They said, "We found our fathers worshipping them."

54.John Medows Rodwell: He said, "Truly ye and your fathers have been in a plain mistake."

55.John Medows Rodwell: They said, "Hast thou come unto us in earnest? or art thou of those who jest?"

56.John Medows Rodwell: He said, "Nay, your Lord is Lord of the Heavens and of the Earth, who hath created them both; and to this am I one of those who witness

57.John Medows Rodwell: - And, by God, I will certainly lay a plot against your idols, after ye shall have retired and turned your backs."

58.John Medows Rodwell: So, he broke them all in pieces, except the chief of them, that to it they might return, inquiring

59.John Medows Rodwell: They said, "Who hath done this to our gods? Verily he is one of the unjust."

60.John Medows Rodwell: They said, "We heard a youth make mention of them: they call him Abraham."

61.John Medows Rodwell: They said, "Then bring him before the people's eyes, that they may witness against him."

62.John Medows Rodwell: They said, "Hast thou done this to our gods, O Abraham?"

63.John Medows Rodwell: He said, "Nay, that their chief hath done it: but ask ye them, if they can speak."

64.John Medows Rodwell: So they turned their thoughts upon themselves, and said, "Ye truly are the impious persons:"

65.John Medows Rodwell: Then became headstrong in their former error and exclaimed,"Thou knowest that these speak not."

66.John Medows Rodwell: He said, "What! do ye then worship, instead of God, that which doth not profit you at all, nor injure you

67.John Medows Rodwell: Fie on you and on that ye worship instead of God! What! do ye not then understand?"

68.John Medows Rodwell: They said: "Burn him, and come to the succour of your gods: if ye will do anything at all."

69.John Medows Rodwell: We said, "O fire! be thou cold, and to Abraham a safety!"

70.John Medows Rodwell: And they sought to lay a plot against him, but we made them the sufferers

71.John Medows Rodwell: And we brought him and Lot in safety to the land which we have blessed for all human beings

72.John Medows Rodwell: And we gave him Isaac and Jacob as a farther gift, and we made all of them righteous

73.John Medows Rodwell: We also made them models who should guide others by our command, and we inspired them with good deeds and constancy in prayer and almsgiving, and they worshipped us

74.John Medows Rodwell: And unto Lot we gave wisdom, and knowledge; and we rescued him from the city which wrought filthiness; for they were a people, evil, perverse

75.John Medows Rodwell: And we caused him to enter into our mercy, for he was of the righteous

76.John Medows Rodwell: And remember Noah when aforetime he cried to us and we heard him, and delivered him and his family from the great calamity

77.John Medows Rodwell: And we helped him against the people who treated our signs as impostures. An evil people verily were they, and we drowned them all

78.John Medows Rodwell: And David and Solomon; when they gave judgment concerning a field when some people's sheep had caused a waste therein; and we were witnesses of their judgment

79.John Medows Rodwell: And we gave Solomon insight into the affair; and on both of them we bestowed wisdom and knowledge. And we constrained the mountains and the birds to join with David in our praise: Our doing was it

80.John Medows Rodwell: And we taught David the art of making mail for you, to defend you from each other's violence: will ye therefore be thankful

81.John Medows Rodwell: And to Solomon we subjected we subjected the strongly blowing wind; it sped at his bidding to the land we had blessed; for we know all things

82.John Medows Rodwell: And sundry Satans who should dive for him and perform other work beside: and we kept watch over them

83.John Medows Rodwell: And remember Job: When he cried to his Lord, "Truly evil hath touched me: but thou art the most merciful of those who shew mercy."

84.John Medows Rodwell: So we heard him, and lightened the burden of his woe; and we gave him back his family, and as many more with them, - a mercy from us, and a memorial for those who serve us

85.John Medows Rodwell: And Ismael, and Edris and Dhoulkefl-all steadfast in patience

86.John Medows Rodwell: And we caused them to enter into our mercy; for they were of the righteous

87.John Medows Rodwell: And Dhoulnoun; when he went on his way in anger, and thought that we had no power over him. But in the darkness he cried "There is no God but thou: Glory be unto Thee! Verily, I have been one of the evil doers:"

88.John Medows Rodwell: So we heard him and rescued him from misery: for thus rescue we the faithful

89.John Medows Rodwell: And Zacharias; when he called upon his Lord saying, "O my Lord, leave me not childless: but there is no better heir than Thyself."

90.John Medows Rodwell: So we heard him, and gave him John, and we made his wife fit for child-bearing. Verily, these vied in goodness, and called upon us with love and fear, and humbled themselves before us

91.John Medows Rodwell: And her who kept her maidenhood, and into whom we breathed of our spirit, and made her and her son a sign to all creatures

92.John Medows Rodwell: Of a truth, this, your religion, is the one Religion, and I your Lord; therefore serve me

93.John Medows Rodwell: But they have rent asunder this their great concern among themselves into sects. All of them shall return to us

94.John Medows Rodwell: And whoso shall do the things that are right, and be a believer, his efforts shall not be disowned: and surely will we write them down for him

95.John Medows Rodwell: There is a ban on every city which we shall have destroyed, that they shall not rise again

96.John Medows Rodwell: Until a way is opened for Gog and Magog, and they shall hasten from every high land

97.John Medows Rodwell: And this sure promise shall draw on. And lo! the eyes of the infidels shall stare amazedly; and they shall say, "Oh, our misery! of this were we careless! yea, we were impious persons."

98.John Medows Rodwell: Verily, ye, and what ye worship beside God, shall be fuel for hell: ye shall go down into it

99.John Medows Rodwell: Were these gods, they would not go down into it; but they shall all abide in it for ever

100.John Medows Rodwell: Therein shall they groan; but nought therein shall they hear to comfort them

101.John Medows Rodwell: But they for whom we have before ordained good things, shall be far away from it

102.John Medows Rodwell: Its slightest sound they shall not hear: in what their souls longed for, they shall abide for ever

103.John Medows Rodwell: The great terror shall not trouble them; and the angel shall meet them with, "This is your day which ye were promised."

104.John Medows Rodwell: On that day we will roll up the heaven as one rolleth up written scrolls. As we made the first creation, so will we bring it forth again. This promise bindeth us; verily, we will perform it

105.John Medows Rodwell: And now, since the Law was given, have we written in the Psalms that "my servants, the righteous, shall inherit the earth."

106.John Medows Rodwell: Verily, in this Koran is teaching for those who serve God

107.John Medows Rodwell: We have not sent thee otherwise than as mercy unto all creatures

108.John Medows Rodwell: SAY: Verily it hath been revealed to me that your God is one God; are ye then resigned to Him? (Muslims.

109.John Medows Rodwell: But if they turn their backs, then SAY: I have warned you all alike; but I know not whether that with which ye are threatened be nigh or distant

110.John Medows Rodwell: God truly knoweth what is spoken aloud, and He also knoweth that which ye hide

111.John Medows Rodwell: And I know not whether haply this delay be not for your trial, and that ye may enjoy yourselves for a time

112.John Medows Rodwell: My Lord saith: Judge ye with truth; for our Lord is the God of Mercy - whose help is to be sought against what ye utter

1.John Medows Rodwell: O MEN of Mecca, fear your Lord. Verily, the earthquake of the last Hour will be a tremendous thing

2.John Medows Rodwell: On the day when ye shall behold it, every suckling woman shall forsake her sucking babe; and every woman that hath a burden in her womb shall cast her burden; and thou shalt see men drunken, yet are they not drunken: but it is the mighty chastisement of God

3.John Medows Rodwell: There is a man who, without knowledge, wrangleth about God, and followeth every rebellious Satan

4.John Medows Rodwell: Concerning whom it is decreed, that he shall surely beguile and guide into the torment of the Flame, whoever shall take him for his Lord

5.John Medows Rodwell: O men! if ye doubt as to the resurrection, yet, of a truth, have We created you of dust, then of the moist germs of life, then of clots of blood, then of pieces of flesh shapen and unshapen, that We might give you proofs of our power! And We cause one sex or the other, at our pleasure, to abide in the womb until the appointed time; then We bring you forth infants; then permit you to reach your age of strength; and one of you dieth, and another of you liveth on to an age so abject that all his former knowledge is clean forgotten! And thou hast seen the earth dried up and barren: but when We send down the rain upon it, it stirreth and swelleth, and groweth every kind of luxuriant herb

6.John Medows Rodwell: This, for that God is the Truth, and that it is He who quickeneth the dead, - and that He hath power over everything

7.John Medows Rodwell: And that "the Hour" will indeed come - there is no doubt of it - and that God will wake up to life those who are in the tombs

8.John Medows Rodwell: A man there is who disputeth about God without knowledge or guidance or enlightening Book

9.John Medows Rodwell: Turning aside in scorn to mislead others from the way of God! Disgrace shall be his in this world; and on the day of the resurrection, We will make him taste the torment of the burning:

10.John Medows Rodwell: "This, for thy handywork of old! for God is not unjust to His servants."

11.John Medows Rodwell: There are some who serve God in a single point. If good come upon one of them, he resteth in it; but if trial come upon him, he turneth him round (to infidelity) with the loss both of this world and of the next! This same is the clear ruin

12.John Medows Rodwell: He calleth upon that beside God which can neither hurt him nor profit him. This same is the far-gone error

13.John Medows Rodwell: He calleth on him who would sooner hurt than profit him. Surely, bad the lord, and, surely, bad the vassal

14.John Medows Rodwell: But God will bring in those who shall believe and do the things that are right, into gardens 'neath which the rivers flow: for God doth that which He pleaseth

15.John Medows Rodwell: Let him who thinketh that God will not help His Apostle in this world and in the next, stretch a cord aloft as if to destroy himself; then let him cut it, and see whether his devices can bring that to nought at which he was angry

16.John Medows Rodwell: Thus send we down the Koran with its clear signs (verses): and because God guideth whom He pleaseth

17.John Medows Rodwell: As to those who believe, and the Jews, and the Sabeites, and the Christians, and the Magians, and those who join other gods with God, of a truth, God shall decide between them on the day of resurrection: for God is witness of all things

18.John Medows Rodwell: Seest thou not that all in the Heavens and all on the Earth adoreth God? the sun and the moon and the stars, and the mountains, and the trees, and the beasts, and many men? But of many is chastisement the due: And whom God shall disgrace there shall be none to honour: God doth that which pleaseth Him

19.John Medows Rodwell: These, the Faithful and the Infidels, are the two disputants who dispute concerning their Lord: but for those who have disbelieved, garments of fire shall be cut out; the boiling water shall be poured down upon their heads

20.John Medows Rodwell: All that is in their bowels, and their skins, shall be dissolved

21.John Medows Rodwell: and there are maces of iron for them

22.John Medows Rodwell: So oft as they, for very anguish, would fain come forth thence, back shall they be turned into it: and - "Taste ye the torment of the burning."

23.John Medows Rodwell: But God will bring in those who shall have believed, and done the things that are right, into gardens 'neath which the rivers flow. Adorned shall they be therein with golden bracelets and with pearls, and their raiment therein shall be of silk

24.John Medows Rodwell: For they were guided to the best of words; guided to the glorious path

25.John Medows Rodwell: But those who believe not, and seduce others from the way of God, and from the Holy Mosque which we have appointed to all men, alike for those who abide therein, and for the stranger; And those who seek impiously to profane it, we will cause to taste a grievous punishment

26.John Medows Rodwell: And call to mind when we assigned the site of the House to Abraham and said: "Unite not aught with Me in worship, and cleanse My House for those who go in procession round it, and who stand or bow in worship:"

27.John Medows Rodwell: And proclaim to the peoples a PILGRIMAGE: Let them come to thee on foot and on every fleet camel, arriving by every deep defile

28.John Medows Rodwell: That they may bear witness of its benefits to them, and may make mention of God's name on the appointed days, over the brute beasts with which He hath supplied them for sustenance: Therefore eat thereof yourselves, and feed the needy, the poor

29.John Medows Rodwell: Then let them bring the neglect of their persons to a close, and let them pay their vows, and circuit the ancient House

30.John Medows Rodwell: This do. And he that respecteth the sacred ordinances of God, this will be best for him with his Lord. The flesh of cattle is allowed you, save of those already specified to you. Shun ye, therefore, the pollutions of idols; and shun ye the word of falsehood

31.John Medows Rodwell: Sound in faith Godward, uniting no god with Him; for whoever uniteth gods with God, is like that which falleth from on high, and the birds snatch it away, or the wind wafteth it to a distant place

32.John Medows Rodwell: This do. And they who respect the rites of God, perform an action which proceedeth from piety of heart

33.John Medows Rodwell: Ye may obtain advantages from the cattle up to the set time for slaying them: then, the place for sacrificing them is at the ancient House

34.John Medows Rodwell: And to every people have we appointed rites, that they may commemorate the name of God over the brute beasts which He hath provided for them. And your God is the one God. To Him, therefore, surrender yourselves: and bear thou good tidings to those who humble them,

35.John Medows Rodwell: Whose hearts, when mention is made of God, thrill with awe; and to those who remain steadfast under all that be-falleth them, and observe prayer, and give alms of that with which we have supplied them

36.John Medows Rodwell: And the camels have we appointed you for the sacrifice to God: much good have ye in them. Make mention, therefore, of the name of God over them when ye slay them, as they stand in a row; and when they are fallen over on their sides, eat of them, and feed him who is content and asketh not, and him who asketh. Thus have We subjected them to you, to the intent ye should be thankful

37.John Medows Rodwell: By no means can their flesh reach unto God, neither their blood; but piety on your part reacheth Him. Thus hath He subjected them to you, that ye might magnify God for His guidance: moreover, announce to those who do good deeds

38.John Medows Rodwell: That God will ward off mischief from believers: for God loveth not the false, the Infidel

39.John Medows Rodwell: A sanction is given to those who, because they have suffered outrages, have taken up arms; and verily, God is well able to succour them

40.John Medows Rodwell: Those who have been driven forth from their homes wrongfully, only because they say "Our Lord is the God." And if God had not repelled some men by others, cloisters, and churches, and oratories, and mosques, wherein the name of God is ever commemorated, would surely have been destroyed. And him who helpeth God will God surely help: for God is right Strong, Mighty:

41.John Medows Rodwell: Those who, if we establish them in this land, will observe prayer, and pay the alms of obligation, and enjoin what is right, and forbid what is evil. And the final issue of all things is unto God

42.John Medows Rodwell: Moreover, if they charge thee with imposture, then already, before them, the people of Noah, and Ad and Themoud

43.John Medows Rodwell: and the people of Abraham, and the people of Lot

44.John Medows Rodwell: and the dwellers in Madian, have charged their prophets with imposture! Moses, too, was charged with imposture! And I bore long with the unbelievers; then seize on them: and how great was the change I wrought

45.John Medows Rodwell: And how many cities which had been ungodly, and whose roofs are now laid low in ruin, have We destroyed! And wells have been abandoned and lofty castles

46.John Medows Rodwell: Have they not journeyed through the land? Have they not hearts to understand with, or ears to hear with? It is not that to these sights their eyes are blind, but the hearts in their breasts are blind

47.John Medows Rodwell: And they will bid thee to hasten the chastisement. But God cannot fail His threat. And verily, a day with thy Lord is as a thousand years, as ye reckon them

48.John Medows Rodwell: How many cities have I long borne with, wicked though they were, yet then laid hold on them to chastise them! Unto Me shall all return

49.John Medows Rodwell: SAY: O men! I am only your open warner

50.John Medows Rodwell: And they who believe and do the things that are right, shall have forgiveness and an honourable provision

51.John Medows Rodwell: But those who strive to invalidate our signs shall be inmates of Hell

52.John Medows Rodwell: We have not sent any apostle or prophet before thee, among whose desires Satan injected not some wrong desire, but God shall bring to nought that which Satan had suggested. Thus shall God affirm His revelations for God is Knowing, Wise

53.John Medows Rodwell: That He may make that which Satan hath injected, a trial to those in whose hearts is a disease, and whose hearts are hardened. - Verily, the wicked are in a far-gone severance from the truth!

54.John Medows Rodwell: And that they to whom "the Knowledge" hath been given, may know that the Koran is the truth from thy Lord, and may believe in it, and their hearts may acquiesce in it: for God is surely the guider of those who believe, into the straight path

55.John Medows Rodwell: But the Infidels will not cease to doubt concerning it, until "the Hour" come suddenly upon them, or until the chastisement of the day of desolation come upon them

56.John Medows Rodwell: On that day the Kingdom shall be God's: He shall judge between them: and they who shall have believed and done the things that are right, shall be in gardens of delight

57.John Medows Rodwell: But they who were Infidels and treated our signs as lies - these then - their's a shameful chastisement

58.John Medows Rodwell: And as to those who fled their country for the cause of God, and were afterwards slain, or died, surely with goodly provision will God provide for them! for verily, God! He, surely, is the best of providers

59.John Medows Rodwell: He will assuredly bring them in with an in-bringing that shall please them well: for verily, God is right Knowing, Gracious

60.John Medows Rodwell: So shall it be. And whoever in making exact reprisal for injury done him, shall again be wronged, God will assuredly aid him: for God is most Merciful, Gracious

61.John Medows Rodwell: So shall it be; for that God causeth the night to enter in upon the day, and He causeth the day to enter in upon the night: and for that God Heareth, Seeth

62.John Medows Rodwell: So shall it be, for that God is the truth; and because what they call on beside Him is vanity: and because God is the Lofty, the Mighty

63.John Medows Rodwell: Seest thou not that God sendeth down water from Heaven, and that on the morrow the earth is clad with verdure? for God is benignant, cognisant of all

64.John Medows Rodwell: His, all in the Heavens and all on Earth: and verily, God! He assuredly is the Rich, the Praiseworthy

65.John Medows Rodwell: Seest thou not that God hath put under you whatever is in the earth; and the ships which traverse the sea at His bidding? And He holdeth back the heaven that it fall not on the earth, unless He permit it! for God is right Gracious to mankind, Merciful

66.John Medows Rodwell: And He it is who hath given you life, then will cause you to die, then will give you life - of a truth man is all ungrateful

67.John Medows Rodwell: To every people have we appointed observances which they observe. Therefore, let them not dispute this matter with thee, but bid them to thy Lord, for thou art on the right way

68.John Medows Rodwell: But if they debate with thee, then Say: God best knoweth what ye do

69.John Medows Rodwell: God will judge between you on the day of resurrection, as to the matters wherein ye differ

70.John Medows Rodwell: Knowest thou not that God knoweth whatever is in the Heaven and on the Earth? This truly is written in the Book: this truly is easy for God

71.John Medows Rodwell: They worship beside God, that for which He hath sent down no warranty, and that of which they have no knowledge: but for those who commit this wrong, no helper

72.John Medows Rodwell: And when our clear signs are rehearsed to them, thou mayst perceive disdain in the countenances of the Infidels. Scarce can they refrain from rushing to attack those who rehearse our signs to them! SAY: Shall I tell you of worse than this? The fire which God hath threatened to those who believe not! Wretched the passage thither

73.John Medows Rodwell: O men! a parable is set forth to you, wherefore hearken to it. Verily, they on whom ye call beside God, cannot create a fly, though they assemble for it; and if the fly carry off aught from them, they cannot take it away from it! Weak the suppliant and the supplicated

74.John Medows Rodwell: Unworthy the estimate they form of God! for God is right Powerful, Mighty

75.John Medows Rodwell: God chooseth messengers from among the angels and from among men: verily, God Heareth, Seeth

76.John Medows Rodwell: He knoweth what is before them and what is behind them; and unto God shall all things return

77.John Medows Rodwell: Believers! bow down and prostrate yourselves and worship your Lord, and work righteousness that you may fare well

78.John Medows Rodwell: And do valiantly in the cause of God as it behoveth you to do for Him. He hath elected you, and hath not laid on you any hardship in religion, the Faith of your father Abraham. He hath named you the Muslims Heretofore and in this Book, that the Apostles may be a witness against you, and that ye may be witnesses against the rest of mankind. Therefore observe prayer, and pay the legal impost, and cleave fast to God. He is your liege Lord - a goodly Lord, and a goodly Helper

1.John Medows Rodwell: HAPPY now the BELIEVERS

2.John Medows Rodwell: Who humble them in their prayer

3.John Medows Rodwell: And who keep aloof from vain words

4.John Medows Rodwell: And who are doers of alms deeds

5.John Medows Rodwell: And who restrain their appetites

6.John Medows Rodwell: (Save with their wives, or the slaves whom their right hands possess: for in that case they shall be free from blame

7.John Medows Rodwell: But they whose desires reach further than this are transgressors:

8.John Medows Rodwell: And who tend well their trusts and their covenants

9.John Medows Rodwell: And who keep them strictly to their prayers

10.John Medows Rodwell: These shall be the heritors

11.John Medows Rodwell: Who shall inherit the paradise, to abide therein for ever

12.John Medows Rodwell: Now of fine clay have we created man

13.John Medows Rodwell: Then we placed him, a moist germ, in a safe abode

14.John Medows Rodwell: Then made we the moist germ a clot of blood: then made the clotted blood into a piece of flesh; then made the piece of flesh into bones: and we clothed the bones with flesh: then brought forth man of yet another make - Blessed therefore be God, the most excellent of Makers

15.John Medows Rodwell: Then after this ye shall surely die

16.John Medows Rodwell: Then shall ye be waked up on the day of resurrection

17.John Medows Rodwell: And we have created over you seven heavens: - and we are not careless of the creation

18.John Medows Rodwell: And we send down water from the Heaven in its due degree, and we cause it to settle on the earth; - and we have power for its withdrawal:

19.John Medows Rodwell: And by it we cause gardens of palm trees, and vineyards to spring forth for you, in which ye have plenteous fruits, and whereof ye eat

20.John Medows Rodwell: And the tree that groweth up on Mount Sinai; which yieldeth oil and a juice for those who eat

21.John Medows Rodwell: And there is a lesson for you in the cattle: We give you to drink of what is in their bellies, and many advantages do ye derive from them, and for food they serve you

22.John Medows Rodwell: And on them and on ships are ye borne

23.John Medows Rodwell: We sent Noah heretofore unto his people, and he said, "O my people! serve God: ye have no other God than He: will ye not therefore fear Him

24.John Medows Rodwell: But the chiefs of the people who believed not said, "This is but a man like yourselves: he fain would raise himself above you: but had it pleased God to send, He would have sent angels: We heard not of this with our sires of old;

25.John Medows Rodwell: Verily he is but a man possessed; leave him alone therefore for a time."

26.John Medows Rodwell: He said, "O my Lord! help me against their charge of imposture."

27.John Medows Rodwell: So we revealed unto him, "Make the ark under our eye, and as we have taught, and when our doom shall come on, and the earth's surface shall boil up, Carry into it of every kind a pair, and thy family, save him on whom sentence hath already passed: and plead not with me for the wicked, for they shall be drowned

28.John Medows Rodwell: And when thou, and they who shall be with thee, shall go up into the ark; say, 'Praise be unto God, who hath rescued us from the wicked folk.

29.John Medows Rodwell: And say, 'O my Lord! disembark me with a blessed disembarking: for thou art the best to disembark."

30.John Medows Rodwell: Verily in this were signs, and verily we made proof of man

31.John Medows Rodwell: We then raised up other generations after them

32.John Medows Rodwell: And we sent among them an apostle from out themselves, with, "Worship ye God! ye have no other God than He: will ye not therefore fear Him?"

33.John Medows Rodwell: And the chiefs of His people who believed not, and who deemed the meeting with us in the life to come to be a lie, and whom we had richly supplied in this present life, said, "This is but a man like yourselves; he eateth of what ye eat, And he drinketh of what ye drink

34.John Medows Rodwell: And if ye obey a man like yourselves, then ye will surely be undone

35.John Medows Rodwell: What! doth he foretell you, that after ye shall be dead and become dust and bones, ye shall be brought forth

36.John Medows Rodwell: Away, away with his predictions

37.John Medows Rodwell: There is no life beyond our present life; we die, and we live, and we shall not be quickened again

38.John Medows Rodwell: This is merely a man who forgeth a lie about God: and we will not believe him."

39.John Medows Rodwell: He said, "O my Lord! help me against this charge of imposture."

40.John Medows Rodwell: He said, "Yet a little, and they will soon repent them!"

41.John Medows Rodwell: Then did the shout of the destroying angel in justice surprise them, we made them like leaves swept down by a torrent. Away then with the wicked people

42.John Medows Rodwell: Then raised we up other generations after them

43.John Medows Rodwell: Neither too soon, nor too late, shall a people reach its appointed time

44.John Medows Rodwell: Then sent we our apostles one after another. Oft as their apostle presented himself to a nation, they treated him as a liar; and we caused one nation to follow another; and we made them the burden of a tale. Away then with the people who believe not

45.John Medows Rodwell: Then sent we Moses and his brother Aaron, with our signs and manifest power

46.John Medows Rodwell: To Pharaoh and his princes; but they behaved them proudly, for they were a haughty people

47.John Medows Rodwell: And they said, "Shall we believe on two men like ourselves, whose people are our slaves?"

48.John Medows Rodwell: And they treated them both as impostors; wherefore they became of the destroyed

49.John Medows Rodwell: And we gave Moses the Book for Israel's guidance

50.John Medows Rodwell: And we appointed the Son of Mary, and His mother for a sign; and we prepared an abode for both in a lofty spot, quiet, and watered with springs

51.John Medows Rodwell: "O ye apostles! eat of things that are good: and do that which is right: of your doings I am cognisant

52.John Medows Rodwell: And truly this your religion is the one religion; and I am your Lord: therefore fear me."

53.John Medows Rodwell: But men have rent their great concern, one among another, into sects; every party rejoicing in that which is their own

54.John Medows Rodwell: Wherefore leave them till a certain time, in their depths of error

55.John Medows Rodwell: What! think they that what we largely, bestow on them of wealth and children

56.John Medows Rodwell: We hasten to them for their good? Nay, they have no knowledge

57.John Medows Rodwell: But they who are awed with the dread of their Lord

58.John Medows Rodwell: And who believe in the signs of their Lord

59.John Medows Rodwell: And who join no other gods with their Lord

60.John Medows Rodwell: And who give that which they give with hearts thrilled with dread because they must return unto their Lord

61.John Medows Rodwell: These hasten after good, and are the first to win it

62.John Medows Rodwell: We will not burden a soul beyond its power: and with us is a book, which speaketh the truth; and they shall not be wronged

63.John Medows Rodwell: But as to this Book, their hearts are plunged in error, and their works are far other than those of Muslims, and they will work those works

64.John Medows Rodwell: Until when we lay hold on their affluent ones with punishment; lo! they cry for help

65.John Medows Rodwell: -"Cry not for help this day, for by Us ye shall not be succoured

66.John Medows Rodwell: Long since were my signs rehearsed to you, but ye turned back on your heels

67.John Medows Rodwell: Puffed up with pride, discoursing foolishly by night."

68.John Medows Rodwell: Do they not then heed the things spoken - whether that hath come to them which came not to their fathers of old

69.John Medows Rodwell: Or do they not recognise their apostle; and therefore disavow him

70.John Medows Rodwell: Or say they, "A Djinn is in him?" Nay! he hath come to them with the truth; but the truth do most of them abhor

71.John Medows Rodwell: But if the truth had followed in the train of their desires, the heavens and the earth, and all that therein is, had surely come to ruin! But we have brought them their warning; and from their warning they withdraw

72.John Medows Rodwell: Dost thou ask them for remuneration? But, remuneration from thy Lord is best; and He is the best provider

73.John Medows Rodwell: And thou indeed biddest them to the right path

74.John Medows Rodwell: But verily they who believe not in the life to come, from that path do surely wander

75.John Medows Rodwell: And if we had taken compassion on them, and relieved them from their trouble, they would have plunged on in their wickedness, wildly wandering

76.John Medows Rodwell: We formerly laid hold on them with chastisement, yet they did not humble them to their Lord, nor did they abase them

77.John Medows Rodwell: Until, when we have opened upon them the door of a severe punishment, lo! they are in despair at it

78.John Medows Rodwell: It is He who hath implanted in you hearing, and sight, and heart; how few of you give thanks

79.John Medows Rodwell: It is He who hath caused you to be born on the earth: and unto Him shall ye be gathered

80.John Medows Rodwell: And it is He who maketh alive and killeth, and of Him is the change of the night and of the day: Will ye not understand

81.John Medows Rodwell: But they say, as said those of old:

82.John Medows Rodwell: They say,"What! When we shall be dead, and have become dust and bones, shall we, indeed, be waked to life

83.John Medows Rodwell: This have we been promised, we and our fathers aforetime: but it is only fables of the ancients."

84.John Medows Rodwell: SAY: Whose is the earth, and all that is therein; - if ye know

85.John Medows Rodwell: They will answer, "God's." SAY: Will ye not, then reflect

86.John Medows Rodwell: SAY: Who is the Lord of the seven heavens, and the Lord of the glorious throne

87.John Medows Rodwell: They will say, "They are God's". SAY: Will ye not, then, fear Him

88.John Medows Rodwell: SAY: In whose hand is the empire of all things, who protecteth but is not protected? if ye know

89.John Medows Rodwell: They will answer, "In God's." SAY: How, then, can ye be so spell-bound

90.John Medows Rodwell: Yea, we have brought them the truth; but they are surely liars

91.John Medows Rodwell: God hath not begotten offspring; neither is there any other God with Him: else had each god assuredly taken away that which he had created, and some had assuredly uplifted themselves above others! Far from the glory of God, be what they affirm of Him

92.John Medows Rodwell: He knoweth alike the unseen and the seen: far be He uplifted above the gods whom they associate with Him

93.John Medows Rodwell: SAY: O my Lord! If thou wilt let me witness the infliction of that with which they have been threatened

94.John Medows Rodwell: O my Lord! place me not among the ungodly people

95.John Medows Rodwell: Verily, we are well able to make thee see the punishment with which we have threatened them

96.John Medows Rodwell: Turn aside evil with that which is better: we best know what they utter against thee

97.John Medows Rodwell: And SAY: "O my Lord! I betake me to Thee, against the promptings of the Satans

98.John Medows Rodwell: And I betake me to Thee, O my Lord! that they gain no hurtful access to me."

99.John Medows Rodwell: When death overtaketh one of the wicked, he saith, "Lord, send me back again

100.John Medows Rodwell: That I may do the good which I have left undone." "By no means." These are the very words which he shall speak: But behind them shall be a barrier, until the day when they shall be raised again

101.John Medows Rodwell: And when the trumpet shall be sounded, the ties of kindred between them shall cease on that day; neither shall they ask each other's help

102.John Medows Rodwell: They whose balances shall be heavy, shall be the blest

103.John Medows Rodwell: But they whose balances shall be light, - these are they who shall lose their souls, abiding in hell for ever

104.John Medows Rodwell: The fire shall scorch their faces, and their lips shall quiver therein:

105.John Medows Rodwell: -"What! Were not my signs rehearsed unto you? and did ye not treat them as lies?"

106.John Medows Rodwell: They shall say, "O our Lord! our ill-fortune prevailed against us, and we became an erring people

107.John Medows Rodwell: O our Lord! Bring us forth hence: if we go back again to our sins, we shall indeed be evil doers."

108.John Medows Rodwell: He will say; "Be ye driven down into it; and, address me not."

109.John Medows Rodwell: A part truly of my servants was there, who said, "O our Lord! we believe: forgive us, then, and be merciful to us, for of the merciful art thou the best."

110.John Medows Rodwell: But ye received them with such scoffs that they suffered you to forget my warning, and ye laughed them to scorn

111.John Medows Rodwell: Verily this day will I reward then, for their patient endurance: the blissful ones shall they be

112.John Medows Rodwell: He will say, "What number of years tarried ye on earth?"

113.John Medows Rodwell: They will say, "We tarried a day, or part of a day; but ask the recording angels."

114.John Medows Rodwell: God will say, "Short indeed was the time ye tarried, if that ye knew it

115.John Medows Rodwell: What! Did ye then think that we had created you for pastime, and that ye should not be brought back again to us?"

116.John Medows Rodwell: Wherefore let God be exalted, the King, the Truth! There is no god but He! Lord of the stately throne

117.John Medows Rodwell: And whoso, together with God, shall call on another god, for whom he hath no proof, shall surely have to give account to his Lord. Aye, it shall fare ill with the infidels

118.John Medows Rodwell: And SAY: "O my Lord, pardon, and have mercy; for of those who show mercy, art thou the best."

1.John Medows Rodwell: A SURA which we have sent down and sanctioned! Clear signs have we sent down therein, that ye may take warning

2.John Medows Rodwell: The whore and the whoremonger - scourge each of them with an hundred stripes; and let not compassion keep you from carrying out the sentence of God, if ye believe in God and the last day: And let some of the faithful witness their chastisement

3.John Medows Rodwell: The whoremonger shall not marry other than a whore or an idolatress; and the whore shall not marry other than a whoremonger or an idolater. Such alliances are forbidden to the faithful

4.John Medows Rodwell: They who defame virtuous women, and bring not four witnesses, scourge them with fourscore stripes, and receive ye not their testimony for ever, for these are perverse persons

5.John Medows Rodwell: Save those who afterwards repent and live virtuously; for truly God is Lenient, Merciful

6.John Medows Rodwell: And they who shall accuse their wives, and have no witnesses but themselves, the testimony of each of them shall be a testimony by God four times repeated, that he is indeed of them that speak the truth

7.John Medows Rodwell: And the fifth time that the malison of God be upon him, if he be of them that lie

8.John Medows Rodwell: But it shall avert the chastisement from her if she testify a testimony four times repeated, by God, that he is of them that lie

9.John Medows Rodwell: And a fifth time to call down the wrath of God on her, if he have spoken the truth

10.John Medows Rodwell: And but for the goodness and mercy of God towards you, and that God is He who loveth to turn, Wise . . . .

11.John Medows Rodwell: Of a truth, they who advanced that lie were a large number of you; but regard it not as an evil to you. No, it is an advantage to you. To every man among them shall it be done according to the offence he hath committed; and as to that person among them who took on himself to aggravate it, a sore punishment doth await him

12.John Medows Rodwell: Did not the faithful of both sexes, when ye heard of this, form a favourable judgment in their own minds, and say, "This is a manifest lie?"

13.John Medows Rodwell: Have they brought four witnesses of the fact? If they cannot produce the witnesses, they are the liars in the sight of God

14.John Medows Rodwell: And but for the goodness of God towards you, and His mercy in this world and in the next, a severe punishment had come upon you for that which ye spread abroad

15.John Medows Rodwell: when ye uttered with your tongues, and spake with your mouths that of which ye had no knowledge. Ye deemed it to be a light matter, but with God it was a grave one

16.John Medows Rodwell: And did ye say when ye heard it, "It is not for us to talk of this affair! O God! By thy Glory, this is a gross calumny?"

17.John Medows Rodwell: God hath warned you that ye go not back to the like of this for ever, if ye be believers

18.John Medows Rodwell: And God maketh His signs clear to you: for God is Knowing, Wise

19.John Medows Rodwell: But as for those who love that foul calumnies should go forth against those who believe, a grievous chastisement awaits them In this world and in the next. And God hath knowledge, but ye have not

20.John Medows Rodwell: And but for the goodness of God towards you and His Mercy, and that God is Kind, Merciful . . .

21.John Medows Rodwell: O ye who believe! follow not the steps of Satan, for whosoever shall follow the steps of Satan, he will enjoin on him what is base and blameworthy; and but for the goodness of God towards you, and His mercy, no one of you had been cleansed for ever: but God maketh whom He will to be clean, and God Heareth, Knoweth

22.John Medows Rodwell: And let not persons of wealth and means among you swear that they will not give to their kindred, to the poor, and to those who have fled their homes in the cause of God; let them rather pardon and pass over the offence. Desire ye not that God should forgive you? And God is Gracious, Merciful

23.John Medows Rodwell: Verily, they who throw out charges against virtuous but careless women, who yet are believers, shall be cursed in this world and in the world to come; and a terrible punishment doth await them

24.John Medows Rodwell: Their own tongues, and hands, and feet, shall one day bear witness against them of their own doings

25.John Medows Rodwell: On that day will God pay them their just due, and they shall know that God is the clear Truth itself

26.John Medows Rodwell: Bad women for bad men, and bad men for bad women; but virtuous women for virtuous men, and virtuous men for virtuous women! These shall be cleared from calumnies; theirs shall be forgiveness and an honourable provision

27.John Medows Rodwell: O ye who believe! enter not into other houses than your own, until ye have asked leave, and have saluted its inmates. This will be best for you: haply ye will bear this in mind

28.John Medows Rodwell: And if ye find no one therein, then enter it not till leave be given you; and if it be said to you, "Go ye back," then go ye back. This will be more blameless in you, and God knoweth what ye do

29.John Medows Rodwell: There shall be no harm in your entering houses in which no one dwelleth, for the supply of your needs: and God knoweth what ye do openly and what ye hide

30.John Medows Rodwell: Speak unto the believers that they restrain their eyes and observe continence. Thus will they be more pure. God is well aware of what they do

31.John Medows Rodwell: And speak to the believing women that they refrain their eyes, and observe continence; and that they display not their ornaments, except those which are external; and that they throw their veils over their bosoms, and display not their ornaments, except to their husbands or their fathers, or their husbands' fathers, or their sons, or their husbands' sons, or their brothers, or their brothers' sons, or their sisters' sons, or their women, or their slaves, or male domestics who have no natural force, or to children who note not women's nakedness. And let them not strike their feet together, so as to discover their hidden ornaments. And be ye all turned to God, O ye Believers! that it may be well with you

32.John Medows Rodwell: And marry those among you who are single, and your good servants, and the handmaidens. If they are poor, God of His bounty will enrich them. God is all-bounteous, Knowing

33.John Medows Rodwell: And let those who cannot find a match live in continence till God of His bounty shall enrich them. And to those of your slaves who desire a deed of manumission, execute it for them, if ye know good in them, and give them a portion of the wealth of God which He hath given you. Force not your female slaves into sin, in order that ye may gain the casual fruitions of this world, if they wish to preserve their modesty. Yet if any one compel them, then Verily to them, after their compulsion, will God be Forgiving, Merciful

34.John Medows Rodwell: And now have we sent down to you clear signs, and an instance from among those who flourished before you, and a caution for the God-fearing

35.John Medows Rodwell: God is the LIGHT of the Heavens and of the Earth. His Light is like a niche in which is a lamp - the lamp encased in glass - the glass, as it were, a glistening star. From a blessed tree is it lighted, the olive neither of the East nor of the West, whose oil would well nigh shine out, even though fire touched it not! It is light upon light. God guideth whom He will to His light, and God setteth forth parables to men, for God knoweth all things

36.John Medows Rodwell: In the temples which God hath allowed to be reared, that His name may therein be remembered, do men praise Him morn and even

37.John Medows Rodwell: Men whom neither merchandise nor traffic beguile from the remembrance of God, and from the observance of prayer, and the payment of the stated alms, through fear of the day when hearts shall throb and eyes shall roll

38.John Medows Rodwell: That for their most excellent works may God recompense them, and of His bounty increase it to them more and more: for God maketh provision for whom He pleaseth without measure

39.John Medows Rodwell: But as to the infidels, their works are like the vapour in a plain which the thirsty dreameth to be water, until when he cometh unto it, he findeth it not aught, but findeth that God is with him; and He fully payeth him his account: for swift to take account is God

40.John Medows Rodwell: Or like the darkness on the deep sea when covered by billows riding upon billows, above which are clouds: darkness upon darkness. When a man reacheth forth his hand, he cannot nearly see it! He to whom God shall not give light, no light at all hath he

41.John Medows Rodwell: Hast thou not seen how all in the Heavens and in the Earth uttereth the praise of God? - the very birds as they spread their wings? Every creature knoweth its prayer and its praise! and God knoweth what they do

42.John Medows Rodwell: God's, the Kingdom of the Heavens and of the Earth: and unto God the final return

43.John Medows Rodwell: Hast thou not seen that God driveth clouds lightly forward, then gathereth them together, then pileth them in masses? And then thou seest the rain forthcoming from their midst; and He causeth clouds like mountains charged with hail, to descend from the heaven, and He maketh it to fall on whom He will, and from whom He will He turneth it aside. - The brightness of His lightning all but taketh away the sight

44.John Medows Rodwell: God causeth the day and the night to take their turn. Verily in this is teaching for men of insight

45.John Medows Rodwell: And God hath created every animal of water. Some go upon the belly; some go upon two feet; some go upon four feet. God hath created what He pleased. Aye, God hath power over all things

46.John Medows Rodwell: Now have we sent down distinct signs. - And God guideth whom He will into the right path

47.John Medows Rodwell: For there are who say "We believe on God and on the Apostle, and we obey;" yet, after this, a part of them turn back. But these are not of the faithful

48.John Medows Rodwell: And when they are summoned before God and His Apostle that He may judge between them, lo! a part of them withdraw

49.John Medows Rodwell: But had the truth been on their side, they would have come to Him, obedient

50.John Medows Rodwell: What! are they diseased of heart? Do they doubt? Are they afraid that God and His Apostles will deal unfairly with them? Nay, themselves are the unjust doers

51.John Medows Rodwell: The words of the believers, when called to God and His Apostle that He may judge between them, are only to say, "We have heard, and we obey:" these are they with whom it shall be well

52.John Medows Rodwell: And whoso shall obey God, and His Apostle, and shall dread God and fear Him, these are they that shall be the blissful

53.John Medows Rodwell: And they have sworn by God, with a most solemn oath, that if thou give them the word, they will certainly march forth. Say: swear ye not: of more worth is obedience. Verily, God is well aware of what ye do

54.John Medows Rodwell: SAY: Obey God and obey the Apostle. Suppose that ye turn back, still the burden of his duty is on him only, and the burden of your duty rests on you. If ye obey Him, ye shall have guidance: but plain preaching is all that devolves upon the Apostle

55.John Medows Rodwell: God hath promised to those of you who believe and do the things that are right, that He will cause them to succeed others in the land, as He gave succession to those who were before them, and that He will establish for them that religion which they delight in, and that after their fears He will give them security in exchange. They shall worship Me: nought shall they join with Me: And whoso, after this, believe not, they will be the impious

56.John Medows Rodwell: But observe prayer, and pay the stated alms, and obey the Apostle, that haply ye may find mercy

57.John Medows Rodwell: Let not the Infidels think that they can weaken God on His own Earth: their dwelling place shall be the Fire! and right wretched the journey

58.John Medows Rodwell: O ye who believe! let your slaves, and those of you who have not come of age, ask leave of you, three times a day, ere they come into your presence; - before the morning prayer, and when ye lay aside your garments at mid-day, and after the evening prayer. These are your three times of privacy. No blame shall attach to you or to them, if after these times, when ye go your rounds of attendance on one another, they come in without permission. Thus doth God make clear to you His signs: and God is Knowing, Wise

59.John Medows Rodwell: And when your children come of age, let them ask leave to come into your presence, as they who were before them asked it. Thus doth God make clear to you his signs: and God is Knowing, Wise

60.John Medows Rodwell: As to women who are past childbearing, and have no hope of marriage, no blame shall attach to them if they lay aside their outer garments, but so as not to shew their ornaments. Yet if they abstain from this, it will be better for them: and God Heareth, Knoweth

61.John Medows Rodwell: No crime shall it be in the blind, or in the lame, or in the sick, to eat at your tables: or in yourselves, if ye eat in your own houses, or in the houses of your fathers, or of your mothers, or of your brothers, or of your sisters, or of your uncles on the father's side, or of your aunts on the father's side, or of your uncles on the mother's side, or of your aunts on the mother's side, or in those of which ye possess the keys, or in the house of your friend. No blame shall attach to you whether ye eat together or apart. And when ye enter houses, salute one another with a good and blessed greeting as from God. Thus doth God make clear to you His signs, that haply ye may comprehend them

62.John Medows Rodwell: Verily, they only are believers who believe in God and His Apostle, and who, when they are with him upon any affair of common interest, depart not until they have sought his leave. Yes, they who ask leave of thee, are those who believe in God and His Apostle. And when they ask leave of Thee on account of any affairs of their own, then grant it to those of them whom thou wilt, and ask indulgence for them of God: for God is Indulgent, Merciful

63.John Medows Rodwell: Address not the Apostle as ye address one another. God knoweth those of you who withdraw quietly from the assemblies, screening themselves behind others. And let those who transgress his command beware, lest some present trouble befall them, or a grievous chastisement befall them, hereafter

64.John Medows Rodwell: Is not whatever is in the Heavens and the Earth God's? He knoweth your state; and one day shall men be assembled before Him, and He will tell them of what they have done: for God knoweth all things

1.John Medows Rodwell: BLESSED be He who hath sent down AL FURKAN (the illumination) on his servant, that to all creatures he may be a warner

2.John Medows Rodwell: His the Kingdom of the Heavens and of the Earth! No son hath He begotten! No partner hath He in his Empire! All things hath He created, and decreeing hath decreed their destinies

3.John Medows Rodwell: Yet have they adopted gods beside Him which have created nothing, but were themselves created: And no power have they over themselves for evil or for good, nor have they power of death, or of life, or of raising the dead

4.John Medows Rodwell: And the infidels say, "This Koran is a mere fraud of his own devising, and others have helped him with it, who had come hither by outrage and lie."

5.John Medows Rodwell: And they say, "Tales of the ancients that he hath put in writing! and they were dictated to him morn and even."

6.John Medows Rodwell: SAY: He hath sent it down who knoweth the secrets of the Heavens and of the Earth. He truly is the Gracious, the Merciful

7.John Medows Rodwell: And they say, "What sort of apostle is this? He eateth food and he walketh the streets! Unless an angel be sent down and take part in his warnings

8.John Medows Rodwell: Or a treasure be thrown down to him, or he have a garden that supplieth him with food . . ." and those unjust persons say, "Ye follow but a man enchanted."

9.John Medows Rodwell: See what likenesses they strike out for thee! But they err, and cannot find their way

10.John Medows Rodwell: Blessed be He who if he please can give thee better than that of which they speak - Gardens, 'neath which the rivers flow: and pavilions will He assign thee

11.John Medows Rodwell: Aye, they have treated the coming of "the Hour" as a lie. But a flaming fire have we got ready for those who treat the coming of the Hour as a lie

12.John Medows Rodwell: When it shall see them from afar, they shall hear its raging and roaring,

13.John Medows Rodwell: And when they shall be flung into a narrow space thereof bound together, they shall invoke destruction on the spot

14.John Medows Rodwell: -"Call not this day for one destruction, but call for destructions many."

15.John Medows Rodwell: SAY: Is this, or the Paradise of Eternity which was promised to the God-fearing, best? Their recompense shall it be and their retreat

16.John Medows Rodwell: Abiding therein for ever, they shall have in it all that they desire! It is a promise to be claimed of thy Lord

17.John Medows Rodwell: And on the day when he shall gather them together, and those whom they worshipped beside God, he will say, "Was it ye who led these my servants astray, or of themselves strayed they from the path?"

18.John Medows Rodwell: They will say, "Glory be to thee! It beseemed not us to take other lords than thee. But thou gavest them and their fathers their fill of good things, till they forgat the remembrance of thee, and became a lost people."
