51.John Medows Rodwell: And Pharaoh made proclamation among his people. Said he, "O my people! is not the kingdom of Egypt mine, and these rivers which flow at my feet? Do ye not behold

52.John Medows Rodwell: Am I not mightier than this despicable fellow, And who scarce can speak distinctly

53.John Medows Rodwell: Have bracelets of gold then been put upon him, or come there with him a train of Angels?"

54.John Medows Rodwell: And he inspired his people with levity, and they obeyed him; for they were a perverse people

55.John Medows Rodwell: And when they had angered us, we took vengeance on them, and we drowned them all

56.John Medows Rodwell: And we made them a precedent and instance of divine judgments to those who came after them

57.John Medows Rodwell: And when the Son of Mary was set forth as an instance of divine power, lo! thy people cried out for joy thereat

58.John Medows Rodwell: And they said, "Are our gods or is he the better?" They put this forth to thee only in the spirit of dispute. Yea, they are a contentious people

59.John Medows Rodwell: Jesus is no more than a servant whom we favoured, and proposed as an instance of divine power to the children of Israel

60.John Medows Rodwell: (And if we pleased, we could from yourselves bring forth Angels to succeed you on earth:

61.John Medows Rodwell: And he shall be a sign of the last hour; doubt not then of it, and follow ye me: this is the right way

62.John Medows Rodwell: And let not Satan turn you aside from it, for he is your manifest foe

63.John Medows Rodwell: And when Jesus came with manifest proofs, he said, "Now am I come to you with wisdom; and a part of those things about which ye are at variance I will clear up to you; fear ye God therefore and obey me

64.John Medows Rodwell: Verily, God is my Lord and your Lord; wherefore worship ye him: this is a right way."

65.John Medows Rodwell: But the different parties fell into disputes among themselves; but woe to those who thus transgressed, because of the punishment of an afflictive day

66.John Medows Rodwell: For what wait they but for the hour "to come suddenly on them, while they expect it not?"

67.John Medows Rodwell: Friends on that day shall become foes to one another, except the God-fearing:

68.John Medows Rodwell: "O my servants! on this day shall no fear come upon you, neither shall ye be put to grief

69.John Medows Rodwell: Who have believed in our signs and become Muslims

70.John Medows Rodwell: Enter ye and your wives into Paradise, delighted."

71.John Medows Rodwell: Dishes and bowls of gold shall go round unto them: there shall they enjoy whatever their souls desire, and whatever their eyes delight in; and therein shall ye abide for ever

72.John Medows Rodwell: This is Paradise, which ye have received as your heritage in recompense for your works

73.John Medows Rodwell: Therein shall ye have fruits in abundance, of which ye shall eat

74.John Medows Rodwell: But in the torment of Hell shall the wicked remain for ever

75.John Medows Rodwell: It shall not be mitigated to them, and they shall be mute for despair therein

76.John Medows Rodwell: For it is not we who have treated them unjustly, but it was they who were unjust to themselves

77.John Medows Rodwell: And they shall cry: "O Malec! would that thy Lord would make an end of us!" He saith: "Here must ye remain."

78.John Medows Rodwell: We have come to you with the truth (O Meccans), but most of you abhor the truth

79.John Medows Rodwell: Have they drawn tight their toils for thee? We too will tighten ours

80.John Medows Rodwell: Think they that we hear not their secrets and their private talk? Yes, and our angels who are at their sides write them down

81.John Medows Rodwell: SAY: If the God of Mercy had a son, the first would I be to worship him

82.John Medows Rodwell: But far be the Lord of the Heavens and of the Earth, the Lord of the Throne, from that which they impute to Him

83.John Medows Rodwell: Wherefore let them alone, to plunge on, and sport, until they meet the day with which they are menaced

84.John Medows Rodwell: He who is God in the Heavens is God in earth also: and He is the Wise, the Knowing

85.John Medows Rodwell: And Blessed be He whose is the kingdom of the Heavens and of the Earth and of all that is between them; for with Him is the knowledge of the Hour, and to Him shall ye be brought back

86.John Medows Rodwell: The gods whom they call upon beside Him shall not be able to intercede for others: they only shall be able who bore witness to the truth and knew it."

87.John Medows Rodwell: If thou ask them who hath created them, they will be sure to say, "God." How then hold they false opinions

88.John Medows Rodwell: And one saith, "O Lord! verily these are people who believe not."

89.John Medows Rodwell: Turn thou then from them, and say, "Peace:" In the end they shall know their folly

1.John Medows Rodwell: Ha. Mim

2.John Medows Rodwell: By this clear Book

3.John Medows Rodwell: See! on a blessed night have we sent it down, for we would warn mankind

4.John Medows Rodwell: On the night wherein all things are disposed in wisdom

5.John Medows Rodwell: By virtue of our behest. Lo! we have ever sent forth Apostles

6.John Medows Rodwell: A mercy from thy Lord: he truly heareth and knoweth all things

7.John Medows Rodwell: Lord of the Heavens and of the Earth and of all that is between them, - if ye be firm in faith

8.John Medows Rodwell: There is no God but He! - He maketh alive and killeth! - Your Lord and the Lord of your sires of old

9.John Medows Rodwell: Yet with doubts do they disport them

10.John Medows Rodwell: But mark them on the day when the Heaven shall give out a palpable SMOKE

11.John Medows Rodwell: Which shall enshroud mankind: this will be an afflictive torment

12.John Medows Rodwell: They will cry, "Our Lord! relieve us from this torment: see! we are believers."

13.John Medows Rodwell: But how did warning avail them, when an undoubted apostle had come to them

14.John Medows Rodwell: And they turned their backs on him, and said, "Taught by others, possessed?"

15.John Medows Rodwell: Were we to relieve you from the plague even a little, ye would certainly relapse

16.John Medows Rodwell: On the day when we shall fiercely put forth our great fierceness, we will surely take vengeance on them

17.John Medows Rodwell: Of old, before their time, had we proved the people of Pharaoh, when a noble apostle presented himself to them

18.John Medows Rodwell: "Send away with me," cried he, "the servants of God; for I am an apostle worthy of all credit

19.John Medows Rodwell: And exalt not yourselves against God, for I come to you with undoubted power

20.John Medows Rodwell: And I take refuge with Him who is my Lord and your Lord, that ye stone me not

21.John Medows Rodwell: And if ye believe me not, at least separate yourselves from me."

22.John Medows Rodwell: And he cried to his Lord, "That these are a wicked people."

23.John Medows Rodwell: "March forth then, said God, with my servants by night, for ye will be pursued

24.John Medows Rodwell: And leave behind you the cleft sea: they are a drowned host."

25.John Medows Rodwell: How many a garden and fountain did they quit

26.John Medows Rodwell: And corn fields and noble dwellings

27.John Medows Rodwell: And pleasures in which they rejoiced them

28.John Medows Rodwell: So was it: and we gave them as a heritage to another people

29.John Medows Rodwell: Nor Heaven nor Earth wept for them, nor was their sentence respited

30.John Medows Rodwell: And we rescued the children of Israel from a degrading affliction

31.John Medows Rodwell: From Pharaoh, for he was haughty, given to excess

32.John Medows Rodwell: And we chose them, in our prescience, above all peoples

33.John Medows Rodwell: And we shewed them miracles wherein was their clear trial

34.John Medows Rodwell: Yet these infidels say

35.John Medows Rodwell: "There is but our first death, neither shall we be raised again

36.John Medows Rodwell: Bring back our sires, if ye be men of truth."

37.John Medows Rodwell: Are they better than the people of Tobba, And those who flourished before them whom we destroyed for their evil deeds

38.John Medows Rodwell: We have not created the Heavens and the Earth and whatever is between them in sport

39.John Medows Rodwell: We have not created them but for a serious end: but the greater part of them understand it not

40.John Medows Rodwell: Verily the day of severing shall be the appointed time of all

41.John Medows Rodwell: A day when the master shall not at all be aided by the servant, neither shall they be helped

42.John Medows Rodwell: Save those on whom God shall have mercy: for He is the mighty, the merciful

43.John Medows Rodwell: Verily the tree of Ez-Zakkou

44.John Medows Rodwell: Shall be the sinner's food

45.John Medows Rodwell: Like dregs of oil shall it boil up in their bellies

46.John Medows Rodwell: Like the boiling of scalding water

47.John Medows Rodwell: "Seize ye him, and drag him into the mid-fire

48.John Medows Rodwell: Then pour on his head of the tormenting boiling water

49.John Medows Rodwell: - 'Taste this:' for thou forsooth art the mighty, the honourable

50.John Medows Rodwell: Lo! this is that of which ye doubted."

51.John Medows Rodwell: But the pious shall be in a secure place

52.John Medows Rodwell: Amid gardens and fountains

53.John Medows Rodwell: Clothed in silk and richest robes, facing one another

54.John Medows Rodwell: Thus shall it be: and we will wed them to the virgins with large dark eyes

55.John Medows Rodwell: Therein shall they call, secure, for every kind of fruit

56.John Medows Rodwell: Therein, their first death passed, shall they taste death no more; and He shall keep them from the pains of Hell:

57.John Medows Rodwell: 'Tis the gracious bounty of thy Lord! This is the great felicity

58.John Medows Rodwell: We have made this Koran easy for thee in thine own tongue, that they may take the warning

59.John Medows Rodwell: Therefore wait thou, for they are waiting

1.John Medows Rodwell: HA. MIM

2.John Medows Rodwell: This Book is sent down from God, the Mighty, the Wise

3.John Medows Rodwell: Assuredly in the Heavens and the Earth are signs for those who believe

4.John Medows Rodwell: And in your own creation, and in the beasts which are scattered abroad are signs to the firm in faith

5.John Medows Rodwell: And in the succession of night and day, and in the supply which God sendeth down from the Heaven whereby He giveth life to the earth when dead, and in the change of the winds, are signs for a people of discernment

6.John Medows Rodwell: Such are the signs of God: with truth do we recite them to thee. But in what teaching will they believe, if they reject God and his signs

7.John Medows Rodwell: Woe to every lying sinner

8.John Medows Rodwell: Who heareth the signs of God recited to him, and then, as though he heard them not, persisteth in proud disdain! Apprise him of an afflictive punishment

9.John Medows Rodwell: And when he becometh acquainted with any of our signs he turneth them into ridicule. These! a shameful punishment for them

10.John Medows Rodwell: Hell is behind them! and neither their gains nor the lords whom they have adopted beside God shall avail them in the least: and theirs, a great punishment

11.John Medows Rodwell: This is "Guidance:" and for those who disbelieve the signs of their Lord is the punishment of an afflictive torment

12.John Medows Rodwell: It is God who hath subjected the sea to you that the ships may traverse it at his bidding, and that ye may go in quest of the gifts of his bounty, and that ye may be thankful

13.John Medows Rodwell: And he hath subjected to you all that is in the Heavens and all that is on the Earth: all is from him. Verily, herein are signs for those who reflect

14.John Medows Rodwell: Tell the believers to pardon those who hope not for the days of God in which He purposeth to reward men according to their deeds

15.John Medows Rodwell: He who doth that which is right, doth it to his own behoof, and whoso doth evil, doth it to his own hurt. Hereafter, to your Lord shall ye be brought back

16.John Medows Rodwell: To the children of Israel gave we of old the Book and the Wisdom, and the gift of Prophecy, and we supplied them with good things, and privileged them above all peoples

17.John Medows Rodwell: And we gave them clear sanctions for our behests: neither did they differ, through mutual envy, till after they had become possessed of knowledge; but thy Lord will judge between them on the day of resurrection, as to the subject of their disputes

18.John Medows Rodwell: Afterwards we set thee over our divine law: follow it then: and follow not the wishes of those who have no knowledge

19.John Medows Rodwell: For against God shall they avail thee nothing. And in sooth, the doers of evil are one another's patrons; but the patron of them that fear Him is God himself

20.John Medows Rodwell: This Book hath insight for mankind, and a Guidance and Mercy to a people who are firm in faith

21.John Medows Rodwell: Deem they whose gettings are only evil, that we will deal with them as with those who believe and work righteousness, so that their lives and deaths shall be alike? Ill do they judge

22.John Medows Rodwell: In all truth hath God created the Heavens and the Earth, that he may reward every one as he shall have wrought; and they shall not be wronged

23.John Medows Rodwell: What thinkest thou? He who hath made a God of his passions, and whom God causeth wilfully to err, and whose ears and whose heart he hath sealed up, and over whose sight he hath placed a veil - who, after his rejection by God, shall guide such a one? Will ye not then be warned

24.John Medows Rodwell: And they say, "There is only this our present life: we die and we live, and nought but time destroyeth us." But in this they have no knowledge: it is merely their own conceit

25.John Medows Rodwell: And when our clear signs are recited to them, their only argument is to say, "Bring back our fathers, if ye speak the truth."

26.John Medows Rodwell: Say: God giveth you life, then causeth you to die: then will He assemble you on the day of resurrection: there is no doubt of it: but most men have not this knowledge

27.John Medows Rodwell: And God's is the kingdom of the Heavens and of the Earth; and on the day when the Hour shall arrive, on that day shall the despisers perish

28.John Medows Rodwell: And thou shalt see every nation KNEELING: to its own book shall every nation be summoned: - "This day shall ye be repaid as ye have wrought

29.John Medows Rodwell: This our Book will speak of you with truth: therein have we written down whatever ye have done."

30.John Medows Rodwell: As to those who have believed and wrought righteously, into his mercy shall their Lord cause them to enter. This shall be undoubted bliss

31.John Medows Rodwell: But as to the Infidels - "Were not my signs recited to you? but ye proudly scorned them, and became a sinful people."

32.John Medows Rodwell: And when it was said, "Verily the Promise of God is truth; and as to the Hour, there is no doubt of it;" ye said, "We know not what the hour is - we conceive it a mere conceit, - we have no assurance of it."

33.John Medows Rodwell: And the evils they have wrought shall rise up into their view, and that at which they mocked shall hem them in on every side

34.John Medows Rodwell: And it shall be said to them, "This day will we forget you as ye forgat your meeting with us this day, and your abode shall be the fire, and none shall there be to succour you:

35.John Medows Rodwell: This, because ye received the signs of God with mockery, and this present life deceived you." On that day therefore they shall not come out from it; and they shall not be asked to win the favour of God

36.John Medows Rodwell: Praise then be to God, Lord of the Heavens and Lord of the Earth; the Lord of the worlds

37.John Medows Rodwell: And His be the greatness in the Heavens and on the Earth; for He is the Mighty, the Wise

46.SurahEnglishNames: The Wind-curved Sandhills, The Dunes, The Sandhills

1.John Medows Rodwell: HA. MIM

2.John Medows Rodwell: The Revelation (sending down) of this Book is from the Mighty, the Wise

3.John Medows Rodwell: We have not created the Heavens and the Earth and all that is between them otherwise than in truth and for a settled term. But they who believe not, turn away from their warning

4.John Medows Rodwell: SAY: What think ye? As for those whom ye invoke beside God, shew me what part of the earth it is which they have created? Had they a share in the Heavens? Bring me a Book sent down by them before this Koran, or traces of their knowledge; - if ye are men of truth

5.John Medows Rodwell: And who erreth more than he who, beside God, calleth upon that which shall not answer him until the day of Resurrection? Yes, they regard not their invocations

6.John Medows Rodwell: And when mankind shall be assembled together, they will become their enemies, and ungratefully disown their worship

7.John Medows Rodwell: And when our clear signs are recited to them, they who believe not say of the truth when it cometh to them, "This is plain sorcery."

8.John Medows Rodwell: Will they say, "He hath devised It?" SAY: If I have devised the Koran, then not one single thing shall ye ever obtain for me from God! He best knoweth what ye utter in its regard! Witness enough is He between me and you! And He is the Gracious, the Merciful

9.John Medows Rodwell: SAY: I am no apostle of new doctrines: neither know I what will be done with me or you. Only what is revealed to me do I follow, and I am only charged to warn openly

10.John Medows Rodwell: SAY: What think ye? If this Book be from God, and ye believe it not, and a witness of the children of Israel witness to its conformity with the Law, and believe, while ye proudly disdain it . . . ? Ah! God guideth not the people guilty of such a wrong

11.John Medows Rodwell: But the infidels say of the believers, "If it were a good Book they would not have been before us in believing it:" And not having submitted to guidance, they proceed to say, "It is an old lying legend!"

12.John Medows Rodwell: But before the Koran was the Book of Moses, a rule and a mercy; and this Book confirmeth it (the Pentateuch) - in the Arabic tongue - that those who are guilty of that wrong may be warned, and as glad tidings to the doers of good

13.John Medows Rodwell: Assuredly they who say, "Our Lord is God," and take the straight way to Him - no fear shall come on them, neither shall they be put to grief

14.John Medows Rodwell: These shall be the inmates of Paradise to remain therein for ever, - the recompense of their deeds

15.John Medows Rodwell: Moreover, we have enjoined on man to shew kindness to his parents. With pain his mother beareth him; with pain she bringeth him forth: and his bearing and his weaning is thirty months; until when he attaineth his strength, and attaineth to forty years, he saith, "O my Lord! stir me up to be grateful for thy favours wherewith thou hast favoured me and my parents, and to do good works which shall please thee: and prosper me in my offspring: for to thee am I turned, and am resigned to thy will" (am a Muslim)

16.John Medows Rodwell: These are they from whom we will accept their best works, and whose evil works we will pass by; among the inmates shall they be of Paradise: - a true promise which they are promised

17.John Medows Rodwell: But he who saith to his parents, "Fie on you both! Promise ye me that I shall be taken forth from the grave alive, when whole generations have already passed away before me?" But they both will implore the help of God, and say, "Alas for thee! Believe: for the promise of God is true." But he saith, "It is no more than a fable of the ancients."

18.John Medows Rodwell: These are they in whom the sentence passed on the nations, djinn and men, who flourished before them, is made good. They shall surely perish

19.John Medows Rodwell: And there are grades for all, according to their works, that God may repay them for their works; and they shall not be dealt with unfairly

20.John Medows Rodwell: And they who believe not shall one day be set before the fire. "Ye made away your precious gifts during your life on earth; and ye took your fill of pleasure in them: This day, therefore, with punishment of shame shall ye be rewarded, for that ye behaved you proudly and unjustly on the earth, and for that ye were given to excesses."

21.John Medows Rodwell: Remember, too, the brother of Ad when he warned his people in AL AHKAF - and before and since his time there have been warners - "Worship none but God: verily I fear for you the punishment of the great day."

22.John Medows Rodwell: They said, "Art thou come to us to turn us away from our gods? Bring on us now the woes which thou threatenest if thou speakest truth."

23.John Medows Rodwell: "That knowledge," said he, "is with God alone: I only proclaim to you the message with which I am sent. But I perceive that ye are a people sunk in ignorance."

24.John Medows Rodwell: So when they saw a cloud coming straight for their valleys, they said, "It is a passing cloud that shall give us rain." "Nay, it is that whose speedy coming ye challenged a blast wherein is an afflictive punishment:

25.John Medows Rodwell: It will destroy everything at the bidding of its Lord!" And at morn nought was to be seen but their empty dwellings! Thus repay we a wicked people

26.John Medows Rodwell: With power had we endued them, even as with power have we endued you; and we had given them ears and eyes and hearts: yet neither their eyes, nor their ears, nor their hearts aided them at all, when once they gainsaid the signs of God; but that punishment which they had mocked at enveloped them on all sides

27.John Medows Rodwell: Of old, too, did we destroy the cities which were round about you; and, in order that they might return to us, we varied our signs before them

28.John Medows Rodwell: But did those whom they took for gods beside God as his kindred deities, help them? Nay, they withdrew from them. Such was their delusion, and their device

29.John Medows Rodwell: And remember when we turned aside a company of the djinn to thee, that they might hearken to the Koran: and no sooner were they present at its reading than they said to each other, "Hist;" and when it was ended, they returned to their people with warnings

30.John Medows Rodwell: They said, "O our people! verily we have been listening to a book sent down since the days of Moses, affirming the previous scriptures; it guideth to the truth, and to the right way

31.John Medows Rodwell: O our people! Obey the Summoner of God, and believe in him, that He may forgive your sins, and rescue you from an afflictive punishment

32.John Medows Rodwell: And he who shall not respond to God's preacher, yet cannot weaken God's power on earth, nor shall he have protectors beside Him. These are in obvious error."

33.John Medows Rodwell: See they not that God who created the Heavens and the Earth, and was not wearied with their creation, is of power to quicken the dead? Yea, he is for all things Potent

34.John Medows Rodwell: And a day is coming when the infidels shall be set before the fire. "Is not this it in truth?" They shall say, "Aye, by our Lord." He said, "Taste then the punishment for that ye would not believe."

35.John Medows Rodwell: Bear thou up, then, with patience, as did the Apostles endued with firmness, and seek not to accelerate their doom. For, on the day when they shall see that with which they have been menaced, It shall be as though they had waited but an hour of the day. Enough! shall any perish save they who transgress

1.John Medows Rodwell: WHOSO believe not, and prevent others from the way of God - their works will He cause to miscarry

2.John Medows Rodwell: But whoso believe, and do things that are right, and believe in what hath been sent down to MUHAMMAD - for it is the truth from their Lord - their sins will He cancel, and dispose their hearts aright

3.John Medows Rodwell: This - because the infidels followed vanity, while those who believe, followed the truth from their Lord. Thus to men doth God set forth their likenesses

4.John Medows Rodwell: When ye encounter the infidels, strike off their heads till ye have made a great slaughter among them, and of the rest make fast the fetters. And afterwards let there either be free dismissals or ransomings, till the war hath laid down its burdens. Thus do. Were such the pleasure of God, he could himself take vengeance upon them: but He would rather prove the one of you by the other. And whoso fight for the cause of God, their works he will not suffer to miscarry

5.John Medows Rodwell: He will vouchsafe them guidance, and dispose their hearts aright

6.John Medows Rodwell: And he will bring them into the Paradise, of which he hath told them

7.John Medows Rodwell: Believers! if ye help God, God will help you, and will set your feet firm

8.John Medows Rodwell: But as for the infidels, let them perish: and their works shall God bring to nought

9.John Medows Rodwell: This - because they were averse from the command which God sent down; Fruitless, therefore, shall their works become

10.John Medows Rodwell: Have they not journeyed through the land, and seen what hath been the end of those who flourished before them? God brought destruction on them: and the like of this doth await the infidels

11.John Medows Rodwell: This - because God is the protector of those who believe, and because the infidels have no protector

12.John Medows Rodwell: Verily God will bring those who believe, and do the things that are right, into the Gardens, beneath whose shades the rivers flow: but they who believe not, take their fill, and eat as the beasts eat! And their dwelling-place the fire

13.John Medows Rodwell: And how many cities were mightier in strength than thy city, which hath thrust thee forth! We destroyed them, and there was none to help them

14.John Medows Rodwell: Shall he who followeth the clear teaching of his Lord be as he, the evil of whose doings hath been made to seem good to him, or like those who follow their own lusts

15.John Medows Rodwell: A picture of the Paradise which is promised to the God-fearing! Therein are rivers of water, which corrupt not: rivers of milk, whose taste changeth not: and rivers of wine, delicious to those who quaff it; And rivers of honey clarified: and therein are all kinds of fruit for them from their Lord! Is this like the lot of those who must dwell for ever in the fire? and shall have draughts of boiling water forced on them which will rend their bowels asunder

16.John Medows Rodwell: Some of them indeed hearken to thee, until when they go out from thee, they say with sneers to those to whom "the knowledge" hath been given, "What is this he said?" These are they whose hearts God hath sealed up, and who follow their own lusts

17.John Medows Rodwell: But as to those who have the guidance, He will increase their guidance, and He will teach them what to fear

18.John Medows Rodwell: For what do the infidels wait, but that the Hour come suddenly on them? Already are its signs come, and when it hath come on them indeed, how can they be warned then

19.John Medows Rodwell: Know, then, that there is no god but God: and ask pardon for thy sin, and for believers, both men and women. God knoweth your busy movements, and your final resting-places

20.John Medows Rodwell: The believers say, "Oh, would that a Sura were sent down!" but when a peremptory Sura is revealed, whose burden is war, thou mayest see the diseased of heart look toward thee, with a look of one on whom the shadows of death have fallen! But better in them would be obedience and becoming language

21.John Medows Rodwell: And if, when the command for war is issued, they are true to God, it will be assuredly best for them

22.John Medows Rodwell: Were ye not ready, if ye had turned back from Him, to spread disorder in the land, and violate the ties of blood

23.John Medows Rodwell: These are they whom God hath cursed, and made deaf, and blinded their eyes

24.John Medows Rodwell: Will they not then meditate on the Koran? Are locks upon their hearts

25.John Medows Rodwell: But as to those who return to their errors after "the guidance" hath been made plain to them, Satan shall beguile them, and fill them with his suggestions

26.John Medows Rodwell: This - because they say to those who abhor what God hath sent down, "We will comply with you in part of what ye enjoin." But God knoweth their secret reservations

27.John Medows Rodwell: But how? When the angels, in causing them to die, shall smite them on the face and back

28.John Medows Rodwell: This - because they follow that which angereth God, and abhor what pleaseth Him: therefore will He make their works fruitless

29.John Medows Rodwell: Think these men of diseased hearts, that God will not bring out their malice to light

30.John Medows Rodwell: If such were our pleasure, we could point them out to thee, and thou surely know them by their tokens: and know them thou shalt, by the strangeness of their words. God knoweth your doings

31.John Medows Rodwell: And we will surely test you, until we know the valiant and the steadfast among you: and we will test the reports of your conduct

32.John Medows Rodwell: Verily they who believe not, and turn others from the way of God, and separate from the Apostle after that "the guidance" hath been clearly shewn them, shall in no way injure God: but their works shall he bring to nought

33.John Medows Rodwell: Believers! obey God and the Apostle: and render not your works vain

34.John Medows Rodwell: Verily those who believe not, and who pervert others from the way of God, and then die in unbelief, God will not forgive

35.John Medows Rodwell: Be not fainthearted then; and invite not the infidels to peace when ye have the upper hand: for God is with you, and will not defraud you of the recompense of your works

36.John Medows Rodwell: Surely this present life is only a play, and pastime! but if ye believe, fear God; He will give you your rewards: but He will not ask all your riches of you

37.John Medows Rodwell: Should He ask them of you, and urge you, ye would shew yourself niggards: and He would bring your grudges to light

38.John Medows Rodwell: Lo! ye are they, who are called to expend for the cause of God: and some of you are niggards: but whoso is niggardly shall be niggard only to his own loss; for God is the Rich, and ye are the poor: and if ye turn back, He will change you for another people, and they shall not be your like

1.John Medows Rodwell: Verily, We have won for thee an undoubted VICTORY

2.John Medows Rodwell: In token that God forgiveth thy earlier and later faults, and fulfilleth His goodness to thee, and guideth thee on the right way

3.John Medows Rodwell: And that God succoureth thee with a mighty succour

4.John Medows Rodwell: He it is who sendeth down a spirit of secure repose into the hearts of the faithful that they might add faith to their faith; (for God's are the armies of the Heavens and of the Earth: and God is Knowing, Wise:

5.John Medows Rodwell: And that He may bring the believing men and the believing women into gardens 'neath whose trees the rivers flow, to dwell therein for ever, and that He may cancel their evil deeds: for this is the great bliss with God

6.John Medows Rodwell: And that He may punish the hypocritical men and the hypocritical women, and the men and women who join other gods with God, and think evil thoughts of Him. Theirs shall be a round of evil; and God is angry with them and curseth them, and hath prepared Hell for them: and, an evil journey thither

7.John Medows Rodwell: The armies of the Heavens and of the Earth are God's, and God is Mighty, Wise

8.John Medows Rodwell: Verily, we have sent thee to be a witness and a herald of good (an announcer), and a warner

9.John Medows Rodwell: That ye may believe on God and on His Apostle; and may assist Him, and honour Him, and praise him, morning and evening

10.John Medows Rodwell: In truth, they who plighted fealty to thee, really plighted that fealty to God: the hand of God was over their hands! Whoever, therefore, shall break his oath shall only break it to his own hurt; but whoever shall be true to his engagement with God, He will give him a great reward

11.John Medows Rodwell: The Arabs who took not the field with you, will say to thee, "We were engaged with our property and our families; therefore ask thou pardon for us." They speak with their tongues what is not in their hearts. SAY: And who can have any power over God in your behalf, whether he will you some loss, or whether he will you an advantage? Yes, God is acquainted with your doings

12.John Medows Rodwell: But ye thought that the Apostle and the faithful could never more come back to their families; and your hearts were pleased at this; and ye thought an evil thought of this expedition, and ye became an undone people

13.John Medows Rodwell: For, whoso believeth not in God, and His Apostle. . . . Verily, we have got ready the flame for the Infidels

14.John Medows Rodwell: And God's is the kingdom of the Heavens and of the Earth: Whom He will He forgiveth, and whom He will He punisheth: and God is Gracious, Merciful

15.John Medows Rodwell: They who took not the field with you will say, when ye go forth to the spoil to take it, "Let us follow you." Fain would they change the word of God. SAY: Ye shall by no means follow us: thus hath God said already. They will say, "Nay, ye are jealous of us." Nay! they are men of little understanding

16.John Medows Rodwell: SAY to those Arabs of the desert, who took not the field, ye shall be called forth against a people of mighty valour. Ye shall do battle with them, or they shall profess Islam. If ye obey, a goodly recompense will God give you; but if ye turn back, as ye turned back aforetime, He will chastise you with a sore chastisement

17.John Medows Rodwell: It shall be no crime on the part of the blind, the lame, or the sick, if they go not to the fight. But whoso shall obey God and His Apostle, he shall bring him into the gardens 'neath which the rivers flow: but whoso shall turn back, He will punish him with a sore punishment

18.John Medows Rodwell: Well pleased now hath God been with the believers when they plighted fealty to thee under the tree; and He knew what was in their hearts: therefore did He send down upon them a spirit of secure repose, and rewarded them with a speedy victory

19.John Medows Rodwell: And with the rich booty which they took: for God is Mighty, Wise

20.John Medows Rodwell: God promised you the taking of a rich booty and sped it to you; and He withheld men's hands from you, for a sign to the faithful, and that He might guide you along the right way:

21.John Medows Rodwell: And other booty, over which ye have not yet had power: but now hath God compassed them for you; for God is over all things Potent

22.John Medows Rodwell: If the Infidels shall fight against you, they shall assuredly turn their backs; then, neither protector nor helper shall they find

23.John Medows Rodwell: Such is God's method carried into effect of old; no change canst thou find in God's mode of dealing

24.John Medows Rodwell: And He it was who held their hands from you and your hands from them in the valley of Mecca, after that He had given you the victory over them: for God saw what ye did

25.John Medows Rodwell: These are they who believed not, and kept you away from the sacred Mosque, as well as the offering which was prevented from reaching the place of sacrifice. And had it not been that ye would have trodden down believers, both men and women, whom ye knew not, so that a crime might have lighted on you without your knowledge on their account, and that God would bring whom He will within His mercy, this would have been otherwise ordered. Had they been apart, we had surely punished such of them as believed not, with a sore punishment

26.John Medows Rodwell: When the unbelievers had fostered rage in their hearts - the rage of ignorance (of heathens) - God sent down His peace on His Apostle and on the faithful, and stablished in them the word of piety, for they were most worthy and deserving of it: and God knoweth all things

27.John Medows Rodwell: Now hath God in truth made good to His Apostle the dream in which he said, "Ye shall surely enter the sacred Mosque, if God will, in full security, having your heads shaved and your hair cut: ye shall not fear; for He knoweth what ye know not; and He hath ordained you, beside this, a speedy victory."

28.John Medows Rodwell: It is He who hath sent His Apostle with "the Guidance," and the religion of truth, that He may exalt it above every religion. And enough for thee is this testimony on the part of God

29.John Medows Rodwell: Muhammad is the Apostle of God; and his comrades are vehement against the infidels, but full of tenderness among themselves. Thou mayst see them bowing down, prostrating themselves, imploring favours from God, and His acceptance. Their tokens are on their faces, the marks of their prostrations. This is their picture in the Law, and their picture in the Evangel: they are as the seed which putteth forth its stalk; then strengtheneth it, and it groweth stout, and riseth upon its stem, rejoicing the husbandman - that the infidels may be wrathful at them. To such of them as believe and do the things that are right, hath God promised forgiveness and a noble recompense

49.SurahEnglishNames: The Private Apartments, The Inner Apartments, The Chambers

1.John Medows Rodwell: O BELIEVERS! enter not upon any affair ere God and His Apostle permit you; and fear ye God: for God Heareth, Knoweth

2.John Medows Rodwell: O Believers! raise not your voices above the voice of the Prophet, neither speak loud to him as ye speak loud one to another, lest your works come to nought, and ye unaware of it

3.John Medows Rodwell: They who lower their voices in the presence of the Apostle of God, are the persons whose hearts God hath inclined to piety. Forgiveness shall be theirs and a rich reward

4.John Medows Rodwell: They who call out to thee while thou art within thine APARTMENTS, have most of them no right perception of what is due to thee

5.John Medows Rodwell: But if they wait patiently till thou come forth to them, it were far better for them. But God is Indulgent, Merciful

6.John Medows Rodwell: O Believers! if any bad man come to you with news, clear it up at once, lest through ignorance ye harm others, and speedily have to repent of what ye have done

7.John Medows Rodwell: And know that an Apostle of God is among you! should he give way to you in many matters ye would certainly become guilty of a crime. But God hath endeared the faith to you, and hath given it favour in your hearts, and hath made unbelief, and wickedness, and disobedience hateful to you. Such are they who pursue a right course

8.John Medows Rodwell: Through the bounty and grace which is from God: and God is Knowing, Wise

9.John Medows Rodwell: If two bodies of the faithful are at war, then make ye peace between them: and if the one of them wrong the other, fight against that party which doth the wrong, until they come back to the precepts of God: if they come back, make peace between them with fairness, and act impartially; God loveth those who act with impartiality

10.John Medows Rodwell: Only the faithful are brethren; wherefore make peace between your brethren; and fear God, that ye may obtain mercy

11.John Medows Rodwell: O Believers! let not men laugh men to scorn who haply may be better than themselves; neither let women laugh women to scorn who may haply be better than themselves! Neither defame one another, nor call one another by nicknames. Bad is it to be called wicked after having professed the faith: and whoso repent not of this are doers of wrong

12.John Medows Rodwell: O Believers! avoid frequent suspicions, for some suspicions are a crime; and pry not: neither let the one of you traduce another in his absence. Would any one of you like to eat the flesh of his dead brother? Surely ye would loathe it. And fear ye God: for God is Ready to turn, Merciful

13.John Medows Rodwell: O men! verily, we have created you of a male and a female; and we have divided you into peoples and tribes that ye might have knowledge one of another. Truly, the most worthy of honour in the sight of God is he who feareth Him most. Verily, God is Knowing, Cognisant

14.John Medows Rodwell: The Arabs of the desert say, "We believe." Say thou: Ye believe not; but rather say, "We profess Islam;" for the faith hath not yet found its way into your hearts. But if ye obey God and His Apostle, he will not allow you to lose any of your actions: for God is Indulgent, Merciful

15.John Medows Rodwell: The true believers are those only who believe in God and His Apostle, and afterwards doubt not; and who contend with their substance and their persons on the path of God. These are the sincere

16.John Medows Rodwell: SAY: Will ye teach God about your religion? when God knoweth whatever is in the Heavens and on the Earth: yea, God hath knowledge of all things

17.John Medows Rodwell: They taunt thee with their having embraced Islam. SAY: Taunt me not with your having embraced Islam: God rather taunteth you with His having guided you to the faith: acknowledge this if ye are sincere

18.John Medows Rodwell: Verily, God knoweth the secrets of the Heavens and of the Earth: and God beholdeth what ye do

1.John Medows Rodwell: Kaf. By the glorious Koran

2.John Medows Rodwell: They marvel forsooth that one of themselves hath come to them charged with warnings. "This," say the infidels, "is a marvellous thing

3.John Medows Rodwell: What! when dead and turned to dust shall we. . . .? Far off is such a return as this?"

4.John Medows Rodwell: Now know we what the earth consumeth of them, and with us is a Book in which account is kept

5.John Medows Rodwell: But they have treated the truth which hath come to them as falsehood; perplexed therefore is their state

6.John Medows Rodwell: Will they not look up to the heaven above them, and consider how we have reared it and decked it forth, and that there are no flaws therein

7.John Medows Rodwell: And as to the earth, we have spread it out, and have thrown the mountains upon it, and have caused an upgrowth in it of all beauteous kinds of plants

8.John Medows Rodwell: For insight and admonition to every servant who loveth to turn to God

9.John Medows Rodwell: And we send down the rain from Heaven with its blessings, by which we cause gardens to spring forth and the grain of harvest

10.John Medows Rodwell: And the tall palm trees with date-bearing branches one above the othe

11.John Medows Rodwell: For man's nourishment: And life give we thereby to a dead country. So also shall be the resurrection

12.John Medows Rodwell: Ere the days of these (Meccans) the people of Noah, and the men of Rass and Themoud, treated their prophets as impostors

13.John Medows Rodwell: And Ad and Pharaoh, and the brethren of Lo

14.John Medows Rodwell: and the dwellers in the forest, and the people of Tobba, all gave the lie to their prophets: justly, therefore, were the menaces inflicted

15.John Medows Rodwell: Are we wearied out with the first creation? Yet are they in doubt with regard to a new creation

16.John Medows Rodwell: We created man: and we know what his soul whispereth to him, and we are closer to him than his neck-vein

17.John Medows Rodwell: When the two angels charged with taking account shall take it, one sitting on the right hand, the other on the left

18.John Medows Rodwell: Not a word doth he utter, but there is a watcher with him ready to note it down

19.John Medows Rodwell: And the stupor of certain death cometh upon him: "This is what thou wouldst have shunned"

20.John Medows Rodwell: And there shall be a blast on the trumpet, - it is the threatened day

21.John Medows Rodwell: And every soul shall come, - an angel with it urging it along, and an angel to witness against it

22.John Medows Rodwell: Saith he, "Of this day didst thou live in heedlessness: but we have taken off thy veil from thee, and thy sight is becoming sharp this day."

23.John Medows Rodwell: And he who is at this side shall say, "This is what I am prepared with against thee."

24.John Medows Rodwell: And God will say, "Cast into Hell, ye twain, every infidel, every hardened one

25.John Medows Rodwell: The hinderer of the good, the transgressor, the doubter

26.John Medows Rodwell: Who set up other gods with God. Cast ye him into the fierce torment."

27.John Medows Rodwell: He who is at his side shall say, "O our Lord! I led him not astray, yet was he in an error wide of truth."

28.John Medows Rodwell: He shall say, "Wrangle not in my presence. I had plied you beforehand with menaces

29.John Medows Rodwell: My doom changeth not, and I am not unjust to man."

30.John Medows Rodwell: On that day will we cry to Hell, "Art thou full?" And it shall say, "Are there more?"

31.John Medows Rodwell: And not far from thence shall Paradise be brought near unto the Pious

32.John Medows Rodwell: - "This is what ye have been promised: to every one who hath turned in penitence to God and kept his laws

33.John Medows Rodwell: Who hath feared the God of Mercy in secret, and come to him with a contrite heart

34.John Medows Rodwell: Enter it in peace: this is the day of Eternity."

35.John Medows Rodwell: There shall they have all that they can desire: and our's will it be to augment their bliss

36.John Medows Rodwell: And how many generations have we destroyed ere the days of these (Meccans), mightier than they in strength! Search ye then the land. Is there any escape

37.John Medows Rodwell: Lo! herein is warning for him who hath a heart, or giveth ear, and is himself an eye-witness

38.John Medows Rodwell: We created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in six days, and no weariness touched us

39.John Medows Rodwell: Wherefore put up with what they say, and celebrate the praise of thy Lord before sunrise and before sunset

40.John Medows Rodwell: And praise Him in the night: and perform the two final prostrations

41.John Medows Rodwell: And list for the day whereon the crier shall cry from a place near to every one alike

42.John Medows Rodwell: The day on which men shall in truth hear that shout will be the day of their coming forth from the grave

43.John Medows Rodwell: Verily, we cause to live, and we cause to die. To us shall all return

44.John Medows Rodwell: On the day when the earth shall swiftly cleave asunder over the dead, will this gathering be easy to Us

45.John Medows Rodwell: We know best what the infidels say: and thou art not to compel them. Warn then by the Koran those who fear my menace

1.John Medows Rodwell: By the clouds which scatter with SCATTERING

2.John Medows Rodwell: And those which bear their load

3.John Medows Rodwell: And by those which speed lightly along

4.John Medows Rodwell: And those which apportion by command

5.John Medows Rodwell: True, indeed, is that with which ye are threatened

6.John Medows Rodwell: And lo! the judgment will surely come

7.John Medows Rodwell: By the star-tracked heaven

8.John Medows Rodwell: Ye are discordant in what ye say

9.John Medows Rodwell: But whose turneth him from the truth, is turned from it by a divine decree

10.John Medows Rodwell: Perish the liars

11.John Medows Rodwell: Who are bewildered in the depths of ignorance

12.John Medows Rodwell: They ask, "When this day of judgment?"

13.John Medows Rodwell: On that day they shall be tormented at the fire

14.John Medows Rodwell: "Taste ye of this your torment, whose speedy coming ye challenged."

15.John Medows Rodwell: But the God-fearing shall dwell amid gardens and fountains

16.John Medows Rodwell: Enjoying what their Lord hath given them, because, aforetime they were well-doers

17.John Medows Rodwell: But little of the night was it that they slept

18.John Medows Rodwell: And at dawn they prayed for pardon

19.John Medows Rodwell: And gave due share of their wealth to the suppliant and the outcast

20.John Medows Rodwell: On Earth are signs for men of firm belief

21.John Medows Rodwell: And also in your own selves: Will ye not then behold them

22.John Medows Rodwell: The Heaven hath sustenance for you, and it containeth that which you are promised

23.John Medows Rodwell: By the Lord then of the heaven and of the earth, I swear that this is the truth, even as ye speak yourselves

24.John Medows Rodwell: Hath the story reached thee of Abraham's honoured guests

25.John Medows Rodwell: When they went in unto him and said, "Peace!" he replied, "Peace: - they are strangers."

26.John Medows Rodwell: And he went apart to his family, and brought a fatted calf

27.John Medows Rodwell: And set it before them. He said, "Eat ye not?"

28.John Medows Rodwell: And he conceived a fear of them. They said to him, "Fear not;" and announced to him a wise son

29.John Medows Rodwell: His wife came up with outcry: she smote her face and said, "What I, old and barren!"

30.John Medows Rodwell: They said, "Thus saith thy Lord. He truly is the Wise, the Knowing."

31.John Medows Rodwell: Said he, "And what, O messengers, is your errand?"

32.John Medows Rodwell: They said, "To a wicked people are we sent

33.John Medows Rodwell: To hurl upon them stones of clay

34.John Medows Rodwell: Destined by thy Lord for men guilty of excesses."

35.John Medows Rodwell: And we brought forth the believers who were in the city

36.John Medows Rodwell: But we found not in it but one family of Muslims

37.John Medows Rodwell: And signs we left in it for those who dread the afflictive chastisement,

38.John Medows Rodwell: And in Moses: when we sent him to Pharaoh with manifest power

39.John Medows Rodwell: But relying on his forces he turned his back and said, "Sorcerer, or Possessed."

40.John Medows Rodwell: So we seized him and his hosts and cast them into the sea; for of all blame was he worthy

41.John Medows Rodwell: And in Ad: when we sent against them the desolating blast

42.John Medows Rodwell: It touched not aught over which it came, but it turned it to dust

43.John Medows Rodwell: And in Themoud: when it was said to them, "Enjoy yourselves for yet a while."

44.John Medows Rodwell: But they rebelled against their Lord's command: so the tempest took them as they watched its coming

45.John Medows Rodwell: They were not able to stand upright, and could not help themselves

46.John Medows Rodwell: And we destroyed the people of Noah, before them; for an impious people were they

47.John Medows Rodwell: And the Heaven - with our hands have we built it up, and given it its expanse

48.John Medows Rodwell: And the Earth - we have stretched it out like a carpet; and how smoothly have we spread it forth

49.John Medows Rodwell: And of everything have we created pairs: that haply ye may reflect

50.John Medows Rodwell: Fly then to God: I come to you from him a plain warner

51.John Medows Rodwell: And set not up another god with God: I come to you from him a plain warner

52.John Medows Rodwell: Even thus came there no apostle to those who flourished before them, but they exclaimed, "Sorcerer, or Possessed."

53.John Medows Rodwell: Have they made a legacy to one another of this scoff? Yes, they are a rebel people

54.John Medows Rodwell: Turn away, then, from them, and thou shalt not incur reproach

55.John Medows Rodwell: Yet warn them, for, in truth, warning will profit the believers

56.John Medows Rodwell: I have not created Djinn and men, but that they should worship me

57.John Medows Rodwell: I require not sustenance from them, neither require I that they feed me

58.John Medows Rodwell: Verily, God is the sole sustainer: possessed of might: the unshaken

59.John Medows Rodwell: Therefore to those who injure thee shall be a fate like the fate of their fellows of old. Let them not challenge me to hasten it

60.John Medows Rodwell: Woe then to the infidels, because of their threatened day

1.John Medows Rodwell: BY the MOUNTAIN

2.John Medows Rodwell: And by the Book writte

3.John Medows Rodwell: On an outspread roll

4.John Medows Rodwell: And by the frequented fane

5.John Medows Rodwell: And by the lofty vault

6.John Medows Rodwell: And by the swollen sea

7.John Medows Rodwell: Verily, a chastisement from thy Lord is imminent

8.John Medows Rodwell: And none shall put it back

9.John Medows Rodwell: Reeling on that day the Heaven shall reel

10.John Medows Rodwell: And stirring shall the mountains stir

11.John Medows Rodwell: And woe, on that day, to those who called the apostles liars

12.John Medows Rodwell: Who plunged for pastime into vain disputes

13.John Medows Rodwell: On that day shall they be thrust with thrusting to the fire of Hell:

14.John Medows Rodwell: "This is the fire which ye treated as a lie

15.John Medows Rodwell: What! is this magic, then? or, do ye not see it

16.John Medows Rodwell: Burn ye therein: bear it patiently or impatiently 'twill be the same to you: for ye shall assuredly receive the reward of your doings."

17.John Medows Rodwell: But mid gardens and delights shall they dwell who have feared God

18.John Medows Rodwell: Rejoicing in what their Lord hath given them; and that from the pain of hell-fire hath their Lord preserved them

19.John Medows Rodwell: "Eat and drink with healthy enjoyment, in recompense for your deeds."

20.John Medows Rodwell: On couches ranged in rows shall they recline; and to the damsels with large dark eyes will we wed them

21.John Medows Rodwell: And to those who have believed, whose offspring have followed them in the faith, will we again unite their offspring; nor of the meed of their works will we in the least defraud them. Pledged to God is every man for his actions and their desert

22.John Medows Rodwell: And fruits in abundance will we give them, and flesh as they shall desire

23.John Medows Rodwell: Therein shall they pass to one another the cup which shall engender no light discourse, no motive to sin

24.John Medows Rodwell: And youths shall go round among them beautiful as imbedded pearls

25.John Medows Rodwell: And shall accost one another and ask mutual questions

26.John Medows Rodwell: "A time indeed there was," will they say, "when we were full of care as to the future lot of our families

27.John Medows Rodwell: But kind hath God been to us, and from the pestilential torment hath he preserved us

28.John Medows Rodwell: For, heretofore we called upon Him - and He is the Beneficent, the Merciful."

29.John Medows Rodwell: Warn thou, then. For thou by the favour of thy Lord art neither soothsayer nor possessed

30.John Medows Rodwell: Will they say, "A poet! let us await some adverse turn of his fortune?"

31.John Medows Rodwell: SAY, wait ye, and in sooth I too will wait with you

32.John Medows Rodwell: Is it their dreams which inspire them with this? or is it that they are a perverse people

33.John Medows Rodwell: Will they say, "He hath forged it (the Koran) himself?" Nay, rather it is that they believed not

34.John Medows Rodwell: Let them then produce a discourse like it, if they speak the Truth

35.John Medows Rodwell: Were they created by nothing? or were they the creators of themselves

36.John Medows Rodwell: Created they the Heavens and Earth? Nay, rather, they have no faith

37.John Medows Rodwell: Hold they thy Lord's treasures? Bear they the rule supreme

38.John Medows Rodwell: Have they a ladder for hearing the angels? Let any one who hath heard them bring a clear proof of it

39.John Medows Rodwell: Hath God daughters and ye sons

40.John Medows Rodwell: Asketh thou pay of them? they are themselves weighed down with debts

41.John Medows Rodwell: Have they such a knowledge of the secret things that they can write them down

42.John Medows Rodwell: Desire they to lay snares for thee? But the snared ones shall be they who do not believe

43.John Medows Rodwell: Have they any God beside God? Glory be to God above what they join with Him

44.John Medows Rodwell: And should they see a fragment of the heaven falling down, they would say, "It is only a dense cloud."

45.John Medows Rodwell: Leave them then until they come face to face with the day when they shall swoon away

46.John Medows Rodwell: A day in which their snares shall not at all avail them, neither shall they be helped

47.John Medows Rodwell: And verily, beside this is there a punishment for the evildoers: but most of them know it not

48.John Medows Rodwell: Wait thou patiently the judgment of thy Lord, for thou art in our eye; and celebrate the praise of thy Lord when thou risest up

49.John Medows Rodwell: And in the night-season: Praise him when the stars are setting

1.John Medows Rodwell: By the STAR when it setteth

2.John Medows Rodwell: Your compatriot erreth not, nor is he led astray

3.John Medows Rodwell: Neither speaketh he from mere impulse

4.John Medows Rodwell: The Koran is no other than a revelation revealed to him

5.John Medows Rodwell: One terrible in power taught it him

6.John Medows Rodwell: Endued with wisdom. With even balance stood he

7.John Medows Rodwell: In the highest part of the horizon

8.John Medows Rodwell: Then came he nearer and approached

9.John Medows Rodwell: And was at the distance of two bows, or even closer,

10.John Medows Rodwell: And he revealed to his servant what he revealed

11.John Medows Rodwell: His heart falsified not what he saw

12.John Medows Rodwell: What! will ye then dispute with him as to what he saw

13.John Medows Rodwell: He had seen him also another time

14.John Medows Rodwell: Near the Sidrah-tree, which marks the boundary
